item.title: Palestine | Pope defends two-state solution when receiving Abbas
item.description: Pope Leo XIV yesterday reiterated his defense of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, when he received the President of the Palestinian Authority, Mahmud Abbas, for the first time in an audience at the Vatican. This first meeting between Abbas and Leo XIV since the pope's election in May also served to mark the tenth anniversary of the signing of the Global Agreement between the Vatican and the State of Palestine, in 2015, the year in which the Catholic Church recognized the Palestinian State. “During the cordial talks, the urgent need to provide assistance to the civilian population in Gaza and to put an end to the conflict, seeking a two-state solution, was recognized,” the Vatican said in a statement. On Wednesday, shortly after arriving in Rome, Abbas went to the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore for a moment of recollection before the tomb of Pope Francis, who died in April. “I came here because I cannot forget everything he did for the Palestinian people,” he told the press. The President of the Palestinian Authority, in power in the West Bank, visited the Vatican on several occasions during Francis' pontificate, having, in 2014, planted an olive tree in the Vatican gardens alongside former Israeli head of state Shimon Peres and Pope Francis, as a symbol of peace. In the last months of his pontificate, the Argentine pope toughened his statements against the Israeli offensive, causing diplomatic tensions with the Israeli embassy. Pope Leo XIV has also expressed solidarity with the “martyred land” of Gaza on several occasions and denounced the forced displacement of Palestinians, but highlighted that the Vatican cannot comment on the alleged genocide in the enclave. On Friday, Abbas will be received in the early afternoon by the Italian Prime Minister, Giorgia Meloni, at the Chigi Palace, the seat of the Government, in Rome.

item.title: Employment | Calls for measures to improve access in construction and retail
item.description: Deputy Leong Pou U argues, in a statement, that measures are necessary to promote employment in the construction sector. Although the latest employment survey by the Statistics and Census Bureau (DSEC) shows a drop in the unemployment rate, Leong Pou U warns of the poor employment situation in some economic sectors, such as construction and retail sales. Leong Pou U emphasizes that unemployment mostly originated in these two sectors, according to DSEC data. In this way, the deputy, linked to the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM), argues that the Government must launch specific support measures, to provide a situation of full employment in the construction sector. Leong Pou U talks about the underemployment situation for many workers in this sector, taking into account that both public and private work have suffered reductions, in addition to the fact that salaries have been frozen for many years. For this reason, the deputy suggests that the Government increases the proportion of workers residing in public works awarded, as well as launching more public works projects.

item.title: Success of “book exchange” leads IC to organize more sessions
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) decided to extend the deadline for carrying out the “Book Exchange” initiative, which covers various activities in the territory's public libraries and community neighborhoods, in order to encourage reading. According to a statement, the extension of the program is due to the fact that “the activity has been widely acclaimed”, so there will be more sessions on weekends during this month and also in December, in order to “further expand the circulation and sharing of books”. Therefore, this weekend, Saturday and Sunday, new book exchange sessions will take place at Praça de Luís de Camões, and then at Largo do Lilau on the 27th and 28th of December. These two sessions join those previously scheduled for the Lateral Space of Jardim Cidade das Flores, on the 22nd and 23rd of November. The timing of all sessions is from 12pm to 6pm. For these sessions, IC describes, “participants only need to take the books that comply with the exchange rules to the staff on site, selecting their favorites and exchanging them for a number equal to their own books”. Standards to comply with The rules determine that magazines, leaflets, guides for entering a school, school books, event catalogs, children's books, yearbooks published non-locally, legal books, exam preparation books, books with pornographic and/or violent content, religious books, books without a publishing license or with copyright infringements, books with incomplete or damaged pages, volumes of books belonging to an incomplete collection, books with loose binding, with pages that are easy to separate or with missing pages cannot be exchanged. pages, books with written or scribbled pages and books with more than five copies. In order to maintain the timeliness and usefulness of the books, science and engineering books published more than five years ago, computer books published more than three years ago, tourist guides published more than two years ago are not accepted. Each person can exchange a maximum of 20 books during the event.

item.title: GP Macau | Race week approaches
item.description: It already smells like a Grand Prix in the city. On Friday, the containers with the sixteen cars from the FIA ​​GT World Cup will be unloaded in the paddock and, after the official stickers have been placed, they will be transported to Praça do Tap Seac, where they will be on display, along with the bikes from the 57th Macau Motorcycle Grand Prix, until Sunday. This year's edition features no less than thirty-two national flags, which will be raised by competitors from the three FIA ​​World Cups and the Kumho FIA TCR World Tour during the packed program of the 72nd Macau Grand Prix. There could have been thirty-three if Serbian Dušan Borković, winner of the 2024 Guia Race, had not been replaced this week by Spaniard Pepe Oriola in one of GOAT Racing's three Hondas. The FIA ​​Formula Regional (FR) World Cup, which is being held for the second time after the debut edition in 2024, has fifteen countries or special administrative regions represented, including Macau. In its first edition, the FIA ​​Formula 4 World Cup features thirteen nationalities on the entry list, while the eighth FIA GT World Cup will be contested by drivers from ten countries or special administrative regions. Therefore, the flags of South Africa, Germany, Argentina, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, China, South Korea, Denmark, United Arab Emirates, Spain, United States of America, Philippines, France, Hong Kong, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Macau, Mexico, Poland, United Kingdom, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Chinese Taipei, Turkey, Uruguay and Vietnam will be seen. Highlight is the absence of the Portuguese flag among the pilots. You have to go back to the beginning of the 1970s to find such a low presence of Portuguese-born pilots at the event. In addition to young Tiago Rodrigues, veterans of the territory Rui Valente and Jerónimo Badaraco will be present, both in the Macau Roadsport Challenge race. The universe of Lusophony is completed with the Brazilian Ethan Nobels, who will make his debut at the Guia Circuit in the F4 race. Couceiro and Lamy present After being the Race Director of the first edition of the FIA ​​FR World Cup, Rui Marques is one hundred percent focused on the Formula 1 World Championship, where he has carried out these functions since last year's Macau Grand Prix. In his place will be Simon Gnana-Pragasam, who performs this role in the FIA ​​Formula 2 and Formula 3 Championships. The Briton will also drive the first Formula 4 World Cup in history. Dino Lodola will be the Race Director of the Guia Race, while the Czech Miroslav Bartos will have this role in the GT race and the only motorcycle race, while the experienced Chinese Zhang Tao will be at the helm of the GT Cup – Great Bay Race (GT4) and the Macau Roadsport Challenge. Two well-known faces from national motorsport will also be present in Macau again, now retired from the tracks, but with other roles on the international scene: Pedro Lamy and Pedro Couceiro. The runner-up in the 1992 Formula 3 Macau Grand Prix, and the first driver to score points in the Formula 1 world championship, Lamy will once again be present as Stewards' Driver Advisor in the FR and Guia Races, a role he has already played in the Guia Circuit and in Formula 1, sharing this role with former F1 driver Vitantonio Liuzzi, who will perform this role in the GT and F4 races. Pedro Couceiro, who, like Pedro Lamy, competed on the streets of Macau in Formula 3 in the 1990s, will be the driver of the Safety Car in the three FIA ​​World Cups and the Guia Race, which this year will be sponsored by BMW Concessionaires (Macau). The former Portuguese driver takes on this position in the FIA ​​World Endurance Championship (WEC) and was previously in the Macao SAR in these roles.

item.title: Colégio S. José 5th | Teacher accused of humiliating student
item.description: In response to the complaint, the school admits an internal investigation into the case, but warned the complainant to prepare for the consequences, because “the Internet is not a lawless space”. The Government reportedly received a complaint about the case on October 14th, but until now it has remained silent A teacher at Colégio Diocesano de São José 5ª is being accused of humiliating a student with autism, allegedly using insulting words, after leaving the student waiting more than 80 minutes for a meeting. The complaint was published on social media, on Monday, by an anonymous user, who justifies the use of this medium with the fact that complaints to the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services (DSEDJ) and the school were ignored. According to the report presented online, the episode took place on October 10th in the school's teachers' room. The student with autism, who attends secondary school, had an appointment with the teacher. However, the teacher arrived 80 minutes late and reprimanded the student: "But you can never do anything well, except be here waiting? Why didn't you ask another teacher to call me?", the teacher asked. "I taught you so many times, but you never listen! You always act as if I never taught you anything", he added. The words disturbed the student who raised his voice against the teacher. However, she again admonished the student: "You are not authorized to speak in that tone of voice! Never speak to a teacher in that way", warned the teacher. After the reprimand, the teacher will have justified, in front of the other teachers present, the arguments used with the fact that the student suffers from autism. List of complaints In view of the case, the author of the online comment admits to having filed a complaint about the teacher's conduct with the DSEDJ, the school's management, the Institute of Social Action, and several deputies, including José Pereira Coutinho, for having received the most votes in the last elections, and Ho Ion Sang, elected indirectly by the education sector. In the complaints presented, an independent investigation into the case was requested, that the teacher be punished due to her conduct and that a review be carried out of the mechanisms for students to defend themselves against teachers when they are targets of abuse. Although the complaint was made on October 14th, by November 3rd the complainant had not received any response, so he decided to make the complaint public, through social media. School investigates With the case going viral, Colégio Diocesano de São José 5ª issued a statement on Tuesday promising an internal investigation, but warning that it will act against defamation attempts. "Recently, our institution became aware of anonymous online complaints about members of our faculty. These allegations concern issues of professional conduct [...] The school takes these matters very seriously and immediately initiated a rigorous internal investigation," the institution said. Furthermore, the college revealed that DSEDJ has started to investigate the case: “The school always defends the rights and legitimate interests of staff and students and will actively cooperate with the supervision and investigation work that has already been initiated by the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services”, it was revealed. Despite this, the school was prepared to target the complainant: “In accordance with the principle of management based on ‘the truth of the facts’, the school […] reserves the right to demand legal responsibility against any fabrications of facts, malicious threats or damage to the reputation of the school and employees — ‘the internet is not a lawless space’!”, it was highlighted. DSEDJ and Coutinho in silence In light of the accusations and inaction, HM contacted DSEDJ to confirm the existence of a complaint dated 14 October and to obtain a reaction to the fact that the complaint remained without any response until the beginning of November. However, at the closing time of the HM edition, no response had been received. As the online publication specifically targeted deputy José Pereira Coutinho, HM tried to get a reaction from the legislator. “I don’t know where this invention came from,” replied the deputy. “I don’t make any comments”, he pointed out. “I am very busy serving dozens of citizens every day in our Citizens Assistance Office”, he added.

item.title: Galaxy | Revenues grow 14% in the third quarter
item.description: In the one-year period, Galaxy's net revenues grew 14 percent. Francis Lui, president of the group, pointed out that the third quarter numbers were achieved, despite the casinos being closed for 33 hours The Galaxy dealership announced an annual increase in net revenues of 14 percent in the third quarter of this year. The data was released yesterday by the concessionaire through a statement. Between July and September, the company that manages the casino with the same name recorded net revenues of 12.2 billion Hong Kong dollars, which represented growth compared to the value of 10.7 billion Hong Kong dollars allocated in the third quarter of 2024. When the comparison is made between the second and third quarters of this year, the growth was less significant, just 1 percent, given that between April and June total net revenue was 12.0 billion Hong Kong dollars. Still in relation to the third quarter, the bulk of the company's revenue founded by Lui Che Woo was due to gaming, which contributed to net revenue with 9.7 billion Hong Kong dollars, while the non-gaming sector brought the company revenues of 1.7 billion dollars. At the same time, Galaxy's building materials segment generated revenues of $727 million, the only segment showing a negative trend. Over the three months between July and September, adjusted EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization) reached 3.3 billion Hong Kong dollars. This amount meant an annual increase of 14 percent, but a reduction of 6 percent, compared to the second quarter of this year. Limited numbers Reacting to the numbers, in a statement, the president of Galaxy, Francis Lui, stated that revenues were affected by the fact that September is a month traditionally with low revenues and due to the passage of typhoon Ragasa. "The first factor involved seasonality, given that September is normally a calmer month, with many visitors postponing their trips until October, to coincide with Golden Week. The second event was Typhoon Ragasa", he indicated. "The typhoon led the Government to decree the official closure of all casinos for 33 hours. And 33 hours may not seem like a very long period of time, but it causes potential visitors to cancel their planned visits", he added. At the same time, Lui also addressed the closure of the Waldo casino, which took place on October 31st: "In accordance with Government policies, the Galaxy Group is committed to safeguarding local employment. In addition to being able to maintain the same positions, employees also had the opportunity to explore a variety of career paths, if they so desired, and received support to transition to a new work environment", he highlighted.

item.title: LAG | Association calls for more quality jobs
item.description: The Choi In Tong Sam Association talks about economic recovery and greater confidence in the Government, but recognizes that there is still a discrepancy between official data and the population's sentiment With the Lines of Government Action (LAG) to be presented on November 18, the Choi In Tong Sam Association defends the need for the Government to adopt long-term measures to promote economic growth. The position was taken by vice-president Kou Ngon Fong, in statements to the newspaper Exmoo. From the association leader's perspective, society needs measures to promote the economy, which stimulate sustained growth, instead of the current measures that are essentially limited to relieving the population of the difficulties experienced in recent years. According to Kou, the economy has “returned to normal” in recent years and there is greater trust among citizens in the Government. However, support, such as the large premium for consumption in community areas, is not enough to promote economic growth. The association therefore calls for more structural measures and points as an example to the increase in the salary of public servants and the minimum wage, which was recently increased by one pataca per hour. The official also recalled that the number of visitors and revenue from the game exceeded society's expectations, however, residents still suffer the impact of post-pandemic changes in terms of quality of employment and cost of living, because the economic recovery is uneven. "People do not feel well, even though the unemployment rate is falling, the room for maneuver to implement salary increases for employees is very limited. People looking for jobs also have difficulty finding suitable vacancies or well-paid jobs", said Kou Ngon Fong. Unrelevant data The vice-president of the Choi In Tong Sam Association also warned of the fact that there is a large discrepancy between the data published by the Government, which shows an economy increasingly recovering, and the sentiment of residents. However, Kou Ngon Fong trusts that the Government knows the real situation in society, because it has just collected opinions to prepare the LAG. Regarding the governance guidelines for next year, Kou warned that it was necessary to increase the value of some subsidies and make the conditions for receiving support clearer. Regarding the financial contribution plan, Kou Ngon Fong revealed that he had received several complaints about the lack of transparency in the implemented rules that require residents to spend 183 days in Macau. The association leader therefore asked the government to be clearer about the criteria applied and to explain them very well publicly.

item.title: New health post in Zone A opened yesterday
item.description: The inauguration ceremony of the new health post in Zone A of the New Urban Landfills took place yesterday, which officially starts operating today. According to a note from the Macau Health Services (SS), this health post has an area of ​​around 1,066 square kilometers and will provide services from Monday to Friday, from 8:30 am to 1:00 pm and from 2:30 pm to 6:00 pm, closing on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. It is a family health unit, which provides “holistic, comprehensive, coordinated and continuous medical services that cover the entire life cycle, including health care for children, women and adults in general, unscheduled outpatient consultations, prevention and treatment of chronic diseases, health promotion, general nursing care, vaccinations and provision of basic medicines”. The SS estimates that the population in Zone A will be 96 thousand people, so, in the first phase of operation, this health post will be equipped with “six health professionals and administrative staff to provide services to the first batch of inhabitants of that area”, and, “in the future, dynamic adjustment [of professionals] will be carried out according to the actual situation”. These explanations were given by Alvis Lo, director of the SS, at the inauguration ceremony of the new health post. Comprehensive Services Alvis Lo also declared that the Health Post of Zone A of Novos Urban Landfills is the first public health institution to be opened in UOPG [Operational Planning and Management Unit] East-2, providing “convenient and comprehensive community medical services to residents of the aforementioned Zone”. The SS director also recalled the existence, throughout the territory, of nine health centers and four posts, including the space opened yesterday. Alvis Lo also highlighted that “today, more than 80 percent of patients with chronic diseases in Macau opt for health centers to receive treatment, which demonstrates that the objective of global health coverage has preliminarily been achieved”.

item.title: CCM | Opera performance season runs until March
item.description: It is on the 27th of this month that the first cultural initiative integrated into the “1st Season of Chinese Culture Shows” begins. These are “A Gathering of Heroes, Invoking the East Wind and The Huarong Passage”, Chinese opera pieces written by the Chinese National Peking Opera Company. But there are more shows to see until March next year This week, Tuesday, the program for the “1st Season of Chinese Culture Shows” was presented, an “artistic banquet” promising “excellent shows with diverse experiences”. The initiative was created from the previous “Season of Performances of National Art Companies in Macau”, with the first performance taking place on November 27th, with the Beijing opera “A Meeting of Heroes. Invoking the East Wind. The Passage of Huarong”, presented in a three and a half hour show by the Chinese National Peking Opera Company, at the Macau Cultural Center (CCM). According to the official description of the show, main artists Yu Kuizhi and Li Shengsu take to the stage, leading the cast that presents “the Chinese lyrical tradition in all its expressiveness”. “Three great plays” and “epics taken from the classic Romance of the Three Kingdoms” are presented, with a “mix of singing and theatrical staging, which highlights a perfect balance between civil and military characters, embodied by a series of historical figures”. On the 28th of this month, it is time to perform, also at CCM, “The Legend of the White Snake”, written by the famous playwright Tian Han and originally directed by the prestigious director Li Zigui. "This recognized masterpiece has been meticulously refined on stage for more than 60 years. Considered a fundamental work of the operatic repertoire, the piece has been performed by countless generations of 'dan' (female roles) performers", reads the show's description. On stage, the artists are Li Shengsu, a distinguished representative and defender of the Mei Lanfang school, who is also a mentor to the talented Zhu Fengyi, an artist with whom she shares the main role of Bai Suzhen (Madam White Snake). “In this re-enactment, the performers magnificently portray the unshakable forbidden love that the legendary character has for a mortal, transporting the audience to a mesmerizing dreamlike scenario”, it also reads. New interpretations The program for this initiative also includes theatrical performances such as “Goodbye, My Concubine”, performed by the Beijing People's Theatre. It is an adaptation based on the original creation of Nobel Prize winner for Literature Mo Yan, and which has as its backdrop the historical confrontation Chu–Han. “The play breaks with the traditional narrative structure of historical drama and explores eternal themes such as power, survival and responsibility through multiple encounters and dialogues that cross time and space between consort Yu and Empress Lü”, it can be read. The performance of the dance theater piece “Mulan”, by the Ningbo Arts and Entertainment Group, is also scheduled. This “main line is filial piety, loyalty, courage and love, combining dance, martial arts, drama and technological elements”. Groups such as the Chinese Coal Mine Artistic Troupe and the Chinese National Opera will also be invited to carry out exchange performances in various locations in Macau, namely in schools and community neighborhoods. Also noteworthy is the fact that the National Opera of China will return to performances in Macau in January next year to present “Golden Lotus Flowers – Concert of Vocal Works of the National Opera of China” in several schools. “The concert brings together masterpieces of Chinese and foreign vocal music, with rich musical pieces and exceptional artists, taking students on a musical journey that crosses East and West”, it is said. In total, this first season includes eight exchange presentations and 50 community activities. “Using Chinese culture as a connecting link, the event aims to create a cultural event that involves the entire population, promote emotional resonance and cultural transmission, working together to build a happy, beautiful and harmonious circle of life,” it is described.

item.title: Philippines | Death toll rises to 142 after typhoon hits
item.description: The number of deaths and missing people caused by Typhoon Kalmaegi continues to rise in the Philippines. Wind gusts reached 180 km/h At least 142 people died and 127 are missing following Typhoon Kalmaegi's passage through the central Philippines, according to official data compiled today by the France-Presse (AFP) news agency. The Philippines' National Department of Civil Defense confirmed 114 deaths, in addition to 28 fatalities recorded by authorities in the province of Cebu, in the center of the country, AFP reported. The previous balance of civil protection in the Philippines showed 85 dead and 75 missing. In Cebu, dozens of people were trapped on the roofs of homes and called for help as water rose rapidly. The provincial government declared a state of calamity to allow for the urgent mobilization of emergency funds. The province of Cebu, with 2.4 million inhabitants, was still recovering from a 6.9 magnitude earthquake that occurred in September, which caused 79 deaths. Most of the victims died by drowning or being hit by debris, following flash floods and landslides caused by the Kalmaegi, which also destroyed houses and swept away vehicles, said on Wednesday the deputy head of the Civil Defense Office, Bernardo Rafaelito Alejandro. Deadly winds As it passed through the central Philippines, Kalmaegi brought winds of 130 kilometers per hour (km/h) and gusts of up to 180 km/h. The army indicated that six soldiers died when an Air Force helicopter crashed in the province of Agusan del Sur, during a humanitarian aid mission. More than 387,000 people were evacuated from risk areas and around 3,500 passengers were stranded in almost a hundred ports due to the navigation ban. Local authorities said years of mining and poor drainage work had worsened the impact of the floods. After crossing the South China Sea, the storm is expected to hit the coast of Vietnam and cause intense rain in northern Thailand, the region's meteorological services said. Every year, around 20 storms or typhoons hit or come close to the Philippines, with the poorest regions of the country generally being the most affected. State of emergency The President of the Philippines, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., yesterday declared a state of emergency in the country, after Typhoon Kalmaegi left at least 142 dead and 127 missing, in the worst disaster to hit the country this year. The declaration of a “state of national calamity” was made by Marcos, during a meeting with disaster response authorities, to assess the consequences of the typhoon. The decision allows the Philippine Government to release emergency funds more quickly and avoid food hoarding and price speculation.

item.title: GP Macau | Government promises to fight the black market
item.description: The Grand Prix Organizing Committee admitted having created a task team against the sale of tickets on the black market. The revelation was made by Lei Si Leng, president of the Sports Institute and coordinator of the Grand Prix Organizing Committee. According to the official's statements, new measures were also adopted in the production of tickets, to prevent counterfeiting, and wristbands will be distributed to prevent tickets from being resold after they have been used. “Reselling even just a penny above the purchase price is illegal,” he said. Lei Si Leng also clarified that people who buy tickets and are unable to attend the races can sell them, as long as they do so at or below the purchase price. The statements were made on the sidelines of the Pai San Grand Prix ceremony and Lei Si Leng revealed that at this time around 90 percent of tickets have been sold and that tickets for Saturday and Sunday are sold out. In addition, some tickets will be reserved to be sold on the day of the races. The person in charge also explained that at this stage the circuit is practically assembled and the organization is now ready to start receiving the cars and motorcycles that will participate in the event.

item.title: José Simões Morais
item.description: In Macau, most commercial establishments have the image of Kuan Tai (Guan Di in Mandarin), who appears with a strong body, red face, long black beard and dressed as a military officer, holding a spear in his right hand. As a person, he is known as Guan Yu and is related to the fall of the Han dynasty and the struggles to establish the Shu kingdom, in the period that preceded the Three Kingdoms. With the name Chang Sheng (长生), he was born in Xiezhou (today Yuncheng, Shanxi province), on the 24th day of the sixth lunar month in the 60s of the 2nd century. As an episode from his youth, it is said that one day a nobleman forcibly wanted to possess a girl and Guan Yu, outraged, killed him. Pursued by the authorities, he had to flee and according to legend, in order not to be recognized, Guanyin (known in Macau as Kun Iam) changed the color of his face to red. Another story says that a rural owner with a lot of power, in order to force everyone to buy water from him, polluted the other sources in the region. Saturated with such infamy, Guan Yu one day killed him and had to flee the city. During this flight, to cross the border (guan), he took the name Guan Yu. In the late Eastern Han dynasty (25-220), the decadent court in Luoyang was dominated by eunuchs and generals. Guan Yu was wandering as a street vendor in Zhuo Municipality (now Hebei Province) when he met Liu Bei and Zhang Fei. The three swore an oath in the Peach Garden to become brothers in arms, with Guan Yu and Zhang Fei vowing to help Liu Bei, linked to the royal house of Han, in his armed uprising to establish the Shu-Han kingdom. At that time there were two other different factions that divided the country and thus in the North, the Wei army led by Cao Cao dominated, in the East and South the Wu forces and in the West, the Shu. There were constant battles between them. Guan Yu, an avid reader of the Classic “Spring-Autumn Annals” (Chunqiu jing) who always accompanied him, had commanded the Shu garrison in Jingzhou for 10 years. In the year 219/220, while engaged in a battle outside the wall against the Wei forces, he was caught in a surprise attack by the Wu army, which was more or less allied with the Shu. The Wu conquered the city and killed Guan Yu, cutting off his head and, as a proof of friendship, handing it over to Cao Cao. Halfway there they learned that the Wei had made a peace agreement with the Shu and so the head was abandoned near Luoyang. The process of his deification was long. Although he was only God of War during the Ming period, when in 1578 Emperor Wan Li gave him the title of Emperor Guan (Guan Di), already in the Sui dynasty he had a temple dedicated to him in the place where he was buried, with the titles being given by all the following dynasties. During his life, Guan Yu had the position of Military Officer (Hou). In the Song dynasty he took the place of King (Wang). Due to his loyalty, honesty, piety, benevolence, sense of justice and courage, he became very popular due to the book San Guo Yan Yi, written at the beginning of the Ming dynasty. In this dynasty he was promoted to Emperor (Di) and then, in 1614, to Sage (Sheng) or Military Saint (Wu Di). As a Being so perfect, all professions want him as their patron and thus he is venerated as the God of War, Literature, Wealth and patron of Martial Arts. In Macau, Guan Di is known as Kuan Tai and the Sam Kai Wui Kun temple, located on Rua Sul of the S. Domingos market, is dedicated to him. There, the image of the God is entirely golden, with no objects in his hands and is accompanied on his left by Chau Chong and on the other side by Kuan Peng. His birthday falls on the 24th of the sixth lunar month, although no festivities are officially held in his honor. 灶神 Zao Shen – the god of the Stove The god of the Stove, known in Macau as Tchôu-Sân (in Mandarin Zao Shen), is the most important of the domestic deities and twice a month (during the New Moon and the Full Moon) he received offerings, despite his birthday only being celebrated on the third day of the eighth Moon. However, the most important ceremonies performed to this god are those that occur before the week-long journey, when the god leaves home and goes to Heaven to perform the annual report to the Jade Emperor about the family of the residence where he is placed. And that is why this god, also known as the god of the Kitchen, as for simplification he came to be called the god of the Kitchen Chimney, has great power over the lives of the people who form the household. It is in the last week of the lunar year that he ascends to Heaven to meet with the Jade Emperor, where he reports to him the events that took place in the room in his charge, returning on the first day of the year, where he is placed again in the kitchen, behind the stove. On the eve of the trip, on the twenty-third day of the last lunar month, the inhabitants of the house offer sacrifices to this deity, filling him with sweets so that he only tells good things to the Jade Emperor. In a ceremony performed only by men, the god of Stove leaves transported on a horse and to make the journey easy and pleasant, one of the male beings in the house takes a candle and burns the image of the god so that it can more easily ascend through smoke to Heaven. Before being named by the Jade Emperor as God of the Stove, or of the Kitchen, he was a husband who, having spent all his money gambling and selling his wife, years later, while begging on the streets, arrived at his former wife's house. She, recognizing him and taking pity on him, takes him to the kitchen where she gives him something to eat. But her current husband arrives and so she doesn't see him, she hides him in the fireplace. When the maid lights the fire, so as not to compromise the charitable woman, she stays there. The Jade Emperor, seeing his sacrifice, named him the god of the Stove, also known as the god of the Kitchen, or the god of the Home. There are other versions of both how the man lost the money and how his ex-wife supported him. She, without being recognized by her ex-husband, gave him some cakes and placed a coin in each one. The man, on the way, met another beggar, who, upon seeing the bag with cakes, asked him for one. He discovered the coin in the middle of the cake and, realizing that the other didn't know about the filling, proposed keeping them all, which he managed in exchange for a small amount. When he later found out what he had done, realizing his bad luck, he decided to commit suicide. The Jade Emperor, seeing his kindness, named him god of the Kitchen. The celebration of this deity's journey to Heaven began in summer, but during the Han dynasty it moved to winter and during the Ming dynasty it was celebrated by the people on the 24th, with sacrifices taking place the day before. Zao Shen is represented in an image containing only his figure, or associated with his consort, or even just characters, which is placed on the first day of the lunar year in the kitchen behind the stove.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Sesshu Toyo (c.1420-1506), the Japanese painter monk who adheres to Chan Buddhism, after years of training in the Hofuku-ji temples and especially in Shokoku-ji, where he studied with the master Tensho Shubun, enters the service of a powerful clan of merchants that allow him to travel to the Celestial Empire. There you will get to know the centuries-old and exceptional art of painting up close and its sources of inspiration. The Ming dynasty was reigning when he disembarked in the city of Ningbo (Zhejiang) where, since the Song and Yuan dynasties, came many paintings admired in Buddhist temples in Japan. During the three years of his stay between 1467-69, he was allowed to travel to Beijing through the admirable landscapes featured in the works of so many painters. But he soon found reasons for inspiration in the coastal city of “serene waves” of Ningbo, where professional painters achieved great success in the huaniao hua genre, “painting of flowers and birds”. His knowledge he would display in paintings of meticulous descriptive realism, such as the triptych Flowers and Birds (each ink and color on silk, 55.9 x 53.4 cm, at the Cleveland Museum of Art). Among these professional painters was one, born in Siming District, who would be immensely recognized named Lu Ji (c. 1429-1505). After being welcomed by a patron, the politician Yuan Zhongche (1377-1459), his talent was recognized, and he was called to the court of Emperor Chenghua (r. 1465-87), but it would be from the following Emperor Hongzhi (r. 1488-1505) that he would receive the qualification of "moral, just and reverent", words that together with those later written by Li Mengyang (1473-1529) in a poem, would reveal the constancy of his upright character: «Lu Ji, with white hair, had a golden incense burner by his side, but at the end of the day he returned home without money to buy wine.» If posterity kept these words it was because historians of painting have always highlighted the moral character of its cultivators, only then able to relate to the world of Creation. Lu Ji would carefully study paintings by old masters in the Birds and Flowers category such as Huang Quan (903-65) but also landscapes such as Ma Yuan and Xia Gui, from the Song dynasty. What can be seen in Autumn Landscape with Herons and Ducks (vertical scroll, ink and color on silk, 147.6 x 54.6 cm, at the Metmuseum) in which the monumental scenery overlaps the figures. In other scrolls, one can notice the taste for symbolic play between figures and words, as in Mandarin ducks and hibiscus rosa sinensis (ink and color on silk, 172.7 x 99.1 cm, at the Metmuseum). By the end of the 15th century, paintings bearing Lu Ji's name appeared in the market by the hundreds. This led some to consider them works “of the hand, not of the heart” but it was necessary to know it like the emperor did or like Sesshu who, to know the art, went to know the people.

item.title: Ana Cristina Alves
item.description: By Ana Cristina Alves – Assistant Researcher and Coordinator of the Educational Service of the Scientific and Cultural Center The image that the Portuguese have of themselves as a whole collective differs internally and externally, according to the thinkers and their ways of being in life, which in turn depend on broader cultural frameworks, their own collectivities. It is not expected that a Frenchman's view of the Portuguese and Portugal will be similar to that of a Chinese person, much less that of a Portuguese person, because their perspectives are conditioned by their historical-cultural development, which will define a specific civilizational stance for each thinker and their personal and collective life history. Furthermore, a foreigner's view of Portugal will always be more distant, for better or for worse, than a Portuguese person's close and committed view to the deepest roots of his being, even if he seeks to be as impartial as possible, as is the case of Miguel Torga, a writer and thinker who loved his country very much, but always in the middle, without letting himself be carried away by romantic and nationalist feelings, for example of Teixeira de Pascoes in The Art of Being Portuguese. Start with external views, those that reach us from beyond the Portuguese sea. Start with the very recent text Astérix na Lusitânia from October 2025 by Fabcaro with drawings by Didier Conrad, impeccably translated into Portuguese by Maria José Pereira and Paula Caetano. The compatriots, the “pá” people, who oscillate in the book between slang and the lyrical features of Portuguese fado, in the best that Amália has to offer, are presented in a critical and ironic way, sometimes scathing, in a tone coming from the French comic and rationalist school, which says what it thinks, because that is how it exists without worrying about the consequences that its open, frontal and critical thinking may have on the Portuguese people who will read these lines in band. drawn, many of them truly comical, but which certainly reach the emotional and nervous chords of the great heroes of the Lusitanian sea. Those in a better mood will take advantage of the pretext to laugh at themselves, while the more serious and sullen will have some difficulty digesting the comic strip, whose main feature is playing around the Portuguese sea, but gastronomically. The Portuguese stand out in the work for their taste for fish and fish sauces, being monotonously excellent in the thousand and one ways of preparing cod, which leads, obviously, to the despair of the illustrious Gallic Obélix, who finds himself surrounded by cod and fish sauce (garum) everywhere. Astérix and Obélix come on a mission to Portugal to help free Malmevês, a Portuguese man sentenced to prison for allegedly trying to poison Caesar with garum. They were called by a Portuguese character, whose name is highly revealing, Tristês. Meanwhile, Malmevês has a daughter, with another symptomatic name, Saudade, with whom Obeléx falls in love. The Lusitanians are left with sadness, longing and melancholy and are not indebted to their beauty, and it is with great regret that the Gauls will have to disguise themselves as Lusitanians to save Malmevês from prison, with the successful mission aided by Gallic intelligence that unmasks the real poisoner and his accomplice. Although the Portuguese are not presented as beautiful, intelligent, and some have little ethics, because they betrayed the hero of heroes, Viriato, their most positive aspects include interesting cuisine, with the exception of cod and fish sauce, but which includes pastel de nata and good wine, even green wine. Cuisine is undoubtedly the highlight of the narrative, from all perspectives, even that of the Discoveries, which are reduced and condensed in a reference to Vasco da Gama's Tasco “Oh Man, in Vasco da Gama's Tasco you discover new worlds” (Fabcaro, 2025, 36). The fact that the Portuguese love fado so much makes the atmosphere very sad for Gallic ears, who weave interesting philosophical considerations throughout the text about it, as it is considered to take away soul strength from Portuguese soldiers and people, who in the heat of the battle are appeased by the doleful and sad song that makes the warriors like this: “I suddenly became so melancholy” (Fabcaro, 2025, 28) or “after all, what do we spend our lives chasing after?” (Ibidem). In short, from this comic we take a look at our collective portrait, a sad and melancholic people, very marked by long years of repression, in which the revolutionaries find themselves in jail, like the one who shouts from behind bars "oh man, listen carefully, damned Romans! The united people will never be defeated." (Fabcaro, 2025, 33). There are true women in arms like Gama in Lusitânia, when it is said, “it would be impossible to carry out the mission without Gama’s help” (Fabcaro, 2025, 47). Finally, the Gallic heroes leave for Gaul, retaining another characteristic that is usually highlighted in relation to the Portuguese, the smoothness of their relationship: "Ah, these Lusitanians! They are so affable to deal with...it's hard to have to leave, isn't it?" (Fabcaro, 2025, 48). The comical philosophical image of this comic cannot be generalized to all French people, but what remains for some is that the illustrious and ancient Portuguese history can be summed up in a remarkable gastronomic heroism, represented by a strong woman, Gama, at the head of Tasco Vasco da Gama and as long as she is at the helm, new worlds of flavor will always be discovered. From the Gallic point of view, so much melancholy and sadness are unnecessary, but in the midst of this “strange way of being” there is an affability that leaves us missing the land and wanting to return. Due to the characteristics of the Chinese mentality, shaped by centuries of Confucian harmony, one cannot expect the same type of open, free, critical record from a Chinese thinker. On the contrary, the descriptions will be carefully chosen so as not to offend other people's sensibilities, as is the case in the work of the thinker and historian Wu Zhiliang (吴志良), Crónicas de Portugal 葡萄牙印象, the result of the author's stay as a student at the country in 1991. Therefore, and recalling an idea with which the article opened, the reflections of a thinker or creative are conditioned by their own way of seeing that is inserted and rooted in their culture. For Wu Zhiliang, the Portuguese are still the descendants of the sea heroes who arrived in China and Macau, fearlessly crossing the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific oceans and, in our days, they are the great drivers of the cultural dialogue of the 16th century, providing a meeting of cultures that was extremely beneficial for the Chinese, because it opened them to other worlds, awakening them to a way that is complementary to the Chinese, which he describes as submissive and peaceful. What is most valued in the introduction and conclusion of the successive portraits of Portugal provided by these Chronicles are the new characteristics that the Chinese and other Eastern peoples are confronted with in their relationship with the Portuguese, above all, the active, restless and restless spirit, which crossed "the magic of Allah with the Indian Bodhisattvas, the Chinese Tao and Japanese meditation with the totally restless spirit of the West. At the source of the discovering, spiritualized and empty force, East and the West converge into one in this humble and silent “void”, the root of all things that transforms into an immense and infinite freedom.騷動的精神，來發現力的本源，在那裡，神意味着虛無。在這力的源泉中，東西方交融在一處，我們在“無”這個萬物之本的謙卑和寂寞中，變得無比自由。》(Wu, 1991,1/ 2). Wu Zhiliang emphasizes throughout the work and, also in the final notes, that the various meetings, including academic ones, provided by institutions in the territory of Macau are an invaluable contribution to friendship and cultural dialogue, this being the correct perspective from the author's point of view to evaluate the role of the Portuguese in the world, which in contemporary times still goes back to its great historical past, much like what happens to Portuguese thinkers and writers, even the most impartial, as is the case of Miguel Torga (1907-1995). This writer born in São Martinho de Anta, a doctor by profession, knows his people well, their joys and sadness, riches, miseries and overcoming. In a very well-executed portrait of the country in Salazar times, Portugal writes, the first edition of which dates back to Coimbra in 1950, assuming very clear perspectives in relation to the Portuguese historical past at home and beyond its borders. Behind the borders dominates the maritime, versatile, cosmopolitan and adventurous capital of Lisbon against the telluric city of Porto, realistic and focused on its roots. Throughout the work, he weaves timely and incisive considerations about the Portuguese mentality, which lead to an image that today perhaps resonates with adventurous people in the character of the soap opera Senhor Ventura, a work dated 1991. This one takes us to China. Returning to Portugal, the author debuts the work in Minho where he makes considerations about the way in which the impoverished Portuguese relate to the life of the sea and emigration: "From time to time he may have a fit of rage and try to escape from himself. A hopeless illusion. Where he arrives will always be him, dying of homesickness and dreaming of returning to the adventure with a small reform. As a balm, he will be left with the narcissism of his exploits past experiences and the somatic satisfaction of seeing the worlds he discovered and civilized grow and progress.” (Torga, 2003, 17). Many were emigrants from the old regime who left just like today: the difference is that today they are much better prepared and educated. The Portuguese who emigrate are, for the most part, qualified professionals holding various degrees and national diplomas, boasting solid training and a desire for the rest of the world. But if people have evolved in social terms, their mentality has not changed that much in terms of the way they relate to their historical past, nor in the taste for risk and adventure that drives them out of the country. The hope will always be that of a better life, although the steps to achieve it are not always well measured. When the author describes Trás-os-Montes, his birthplace, he tells us about the emigrants "Haunted by necessity and the love of adventure, at the age of twenty (if it was not earlier), after militancy, some emigrate to the Arabian overseas. Brazil, Africa and Oceania, they put the whole chimera in a bag of scraps and off they go" (Torga, 2003, 50). This is a trait of the Portuguese mentality that has remained in a constant regime since the Discoveries, the desire and need to leave not only due to lack of opportunities, but also due to the thirst for adventure, as well as the naturalness of miscegenation, which can be seen in the capital of Portugal since the times of “Dona Filipa de Lencastre giving birth on behalf of the Portuguese herd from abroad” (Torga, 2003, 77), or even further, since the very foundation of the land. derived from the energy of a son of a French father and a Spanish mother. However, the greatest danger for Portugal and the community as a whole is, according to Torga's perspective, wasting the soul strength of the Portuguese and their characteristics on inconsequential adventures that can contribute nothing to their individual life projects and/or the common good, but which we narcissistically insist on reliving. He tells us about Lisbon "Narcissus that we were also one day, a destiny like that of Cephisus's son awaited us. Lisbon is that flower that destiny transformed us into; the Tagus, the river where we lost ourselves contemplating our own image" (Torga, 2003, 136). It is precisely this mix of pride, vanity and initiative that the work O Senhor Ventura shows. The protagonist is a man from Penedono, in Alentejo, but with multiple resources and capable of taking on any work. With a powerful and bullish constitution, after an adventurous experience of military service that led him to Macau and a short romance with Júlia, the daughter of the Governor's secretary, he deserted the army and joined the world as a sailor aboard a ship doing cabotage in the China Sea. From there he became an employee in a Ford garage in Beijing, where he befriended Pereira, a man from Minho who cooked very well, and he was his companion on adventures until his death. However, Ventura falls into the good graces of Ford's boss, Mr. Hughes, for being “a man of pulse and initiative” (Torga, 2003, 26). In life, he did a bit of everything, trafficking drugs and weapons, being a pirate, kidnapping, driving 200 trucks to Mongolia and, to his misfortune, he fell in love with a Russian woman with an unrecommended life, Tatiana. Although warned, even by himself, because the couple got along very badly, he wanted to marry her, with whom he had a son, Sérgio. It was then that he decided to get rich by getting involved in drug trafficking, more specifically heroin. This new branch of activity went badly for him, he was discovered by the Chinese authorities and he had to return to Portugal, leaving his son in the care of his wife, who betrayed him as soon as she turned her back. He returned to Alentejo within a period of 5 years so that the Chinese authorities would forget about the matter. Anyway, he was in Portugal and returned to China when he discovered that his wife had cheated on him. He looked for her everywhere until, already dying, she was the one who found him to close his eyes on his deathbed. The word that best characterizes Mr. Ventura is, according to the author, “Action – was his great word.” (Torga, 2003,64). The writer is careful to warn about this story: “at each stop I do nothing more than try a small meditation on destiny, which is more collective than individual” (Torga, 2003, 70), adding that the fact that the Alentejo native is returning to the land is an imperative call from destiny, to put him back in touch with his roots, in a new opportunity for life. The protagonist rejects the chance, due to the obsession he felt with his Russian passion and which will lead him to death, ending the author with the following reflection: “Strange hands buried the poor adventurer's withered body the next day in the foreign land where he had to pay the price for his adventures.” (Torga, 2003, 100). Of the two foreign and most distant images from the Portuguese, one critical and playful by the hands of the French artist Fabrice Caro (Fabcaro), another uplifting and very positive transmitted by the Chinese thinker, Wu Zhiliang, to which is added a third, more realistic and closer transmitted by the Portuguese writer, it cannot be concluded that there is just one true one. The collective portrait can only be obtained together and in a kind of Nietzschean perspectivism from the essential traits of the contemporary Portuguese mentality, shaped, as the French artist saw well, by centuries of erasure, but also by the awareness of the glorious exploits of an intercultural past that continues to the present, according to Wu Zhiliang, or even by the thirst for action and adventure which, when not properly structured and rooted in solid individual and collective plans, can lead to a inopportune dead end. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Pope Leo XIV yesterday reiterated his defense of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, when he received the President of the Palestinian Authority, Mahmud Abbas, for the first time in an audience at the Vatican. This first meeting between Abbas and Leo XIV since the pope's election in May also served to mark the tenth anniversary of the signing of the Global Agreement between the Vatican and the State of Palestine, in 2015, the year in which the Catholic Church recognized the Palestinian State. “During the cordial talks, the urgent need to provide assistance to the civilian population in Gaza and to put an end to the conflict, seeking a two-state solution, was recognized,” the Vatican said in a statement. On Wednesday, shortly after arriving in Rome, Abbas went to the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore for a moment of recollection before the tomb of Pope Francis, who died in April. “I came here because I cannot forget everything he did for the Palestinian people,” he told the press. The President of the Palestinian Authority, in power in the West Bank, visited the Vatican on several occasions during Francis' pontificate, having, in 2014, planted an olive tree in the Vatican gardens alongside former Israeli head of state Shimon Peres and Pope Francis, as a symbol of peace. In the last months of his pontificate, the Argentine pope toughened his statements against the Israeli offensive, causing diplomatic tensions with the Israeli embassy. Pope Leo XIV has also expressed solidarity with the “martyred land” of Gaza on several occasions and denounced the forced displacement of Palestinians, but highlighted that the Vatican cannot comment on the alleged genocide in the enclave. On Friday, Abbas will be received in the early afternoon by the Italian Prime Minister, Giorgia Meloni, at the Chigi Palace, the seat of the Government, in Rome.

item.title: Pop Mart, maker of Labubu, falls 10.8% in Hong Kong amid doubts about growth
item.description: Shares in Pop Mart, the Chinese company responsible for the global phenomenon of Labubu figures, sank 10.8% this Thursday, the biggest drop since April, in a new episode of volatility that contrasts with the good sales results released the day before. The devaluation reflects investors' growing caution regarding the possibility of a slowdown in the company's growth, after several quarters driven by the popularity of its collectible products. On Wednesday, Pop Mart shares rose 4.23% on the Hong Kong stock exchange, despite the negative tone of the market, following the announcement that revenue in the third quarter increased between 245% and 250%, driven by Labubu's virality on social media and the company's international expansion. According to data provided by the company, domestic sales grew 190%, while international sales soared 370%, highlighted by increases of 175% in the Asia-Pacific region, more than 740% in Europe and almost 1,270% in the United States. The strong drop recorded today is largely attributed to profit taking, after appreciation of more than 186% since the beginning of the year, and uncertainty about the sustainability of the current growth rate. The stock fell 8.1% on Tuesday, its worst performance since April, weighed down by fears of a slowdown in sales after months of euphoria. The preliminary release of results helped to temporarily dispel these concerns, but the absence of an official date for the presentation of the accounts maintains uncertainty regarding the company's future evolution. Executive chairman and founder Wang Ning expressed confidence in the long-term resilience of the Labubu character, arguing that cultural icons continue to generate revenue even after peak popularity. According to the Bloomberg agency, the explosion in demand forced the company itself to revise its internal goals upwards. If at the beginning of 2024 Pop Mart predicted a turnover of 2,800 million dollars (around 2,400 million euros), in August Wang raised this target to 4,200 million dollars (3,600 million euros), pointing to the brand's global momentum as a key factor. Founded in Beijing in 2010, Pop Mart has established itself as one of the main Asian references in the toy and collectible figures sector, combining exclusive design, limited editions and collaborations with international brands, artists and franchises. Its business model is based on so-called “surprise boxes”, which encourage repeat purchases and have created a community of fans willing to pay high premiums for rare pieces. Among its main lines is Labubu, a monster with pointy ears and a mischievous smile inspired by Norse mythology, created by Hong Kong artist Lung Ka-sing in 2015 and integrated into the company's portfolio in 2019.

item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Venezuela | Maduro declares that country will never be defeated
item.description: The President of Venezuela declared yesterday that the country will never be defeated and that the Venezuelan people will respond to what he considered to be a psychological war orchestrated by the United States. Speaking to the official Venezuelan television station VTV, Nicolás Maduro stated that the authorities and people of Venezuela will respond with work and achievements to the “psychological war”, referring to the North American Administration as “media scoundrels” from Miami. “How do you say ‘imbecile’ in English?” asked Maduro, warning those “who want to do harm” will never be able to defeat Venezuela. Washington has intensified military operations off Venezuela in recent days, reiterating accusations against Maduro that he promotes drug trafficking. The North American head of state, Donald Trump, also authorized new attacks against vessels, allegedly belonging to drug trafficking networks, near the Venezuelan coast. Maduro added that Venezuelan security forces have seized 63 tons of drugs since the beginning of the year. On the other hand, the Venezuelan leader also denounced the attempt to enter Venezuela by two planes linked to drug trafficking. In the same speech, Maduro declared that Venezuela and Russia are making progress in military cooperation, which he described as peaceful and fruitful. Daily contact Asked about contacts between Caracas and Moscow in the context of “threats” from the United States, Maduro stated that the government maintains daily communication with Russian President Vladimir Putin on “several developing issues”, including military matters. On Sunday, the Russian Presidency admitted having maintained contacts with Venezuela regarding a possible request for help from Maduro to Putin. At the same time, the People's Republic of China stated that there is normal cooperation between Beijing and Caracas. The North American newspaper Washington Post reported that the Venezuelan President asked Russia, China and Iran for help to defend the country from pressure from the United States. Para Pequim, trata-se de uma cooperação entre Estados soberanos e que não é dirigida contra terceiros. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said at a press conference that China supports strengthening international cooperation to combat “transnational crime” and opposes the use or threat of such force in international relations.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: LAG | Association calls for more quality jobs
item.description: The Choi In Tong Sam Association talks about economic recovery and greater confidence in the Government, but recognizes that there is still a discrepancy between official data and the population's sentiment With the Lines of Government Action (LAG) to be presented on November 18, the Choi In Tong Sam Association defends the need for the Government to adopt long-term measures to promote economic growth. The position was taken by vice-president Kou Ngon Fong, in statements to the newspaper Exmoo. From the association leader's perspective, society needs measures to promote the economy, which stimulate sustained growth, instead of the current measures that are essentially limited to relieving the population of the difficulties experienced in recent years. According to Kou, the economy has “returned to normal” in recent years and there is greater trust among citizens in the Government. However, support, such as the large premium for consumption in community areas, is not enough to promote economic growth. The association therefore calls for more structural measures and points as an example to the increase in the salary of public servants and the minimum wage, which was recently increased by one pataca per hour. The official also recalled that the number of visitors and revenue from the game exceeded society's expectations, however, residents still suffer the impact of post-pandemic changes in terms of quality of employment and cost of living, because the economic recovery is uneven. "People do not feel well, even though the unemployment rate is falling, the room for maneuver to implement salary increases for employees is very limited. People looking for jobs also have difficulty finding suitable vacancies or well-paid jobs", said Kou Ngon Fong. Unrelevant data The vice-president of the Choi In Tong Sam Association also warned of the fact that there is a large discrepancy between the data published by the Government, which shows an economy increasingly recovering, and the sentiment of residents. However, Kou Ngon Fong trusts that the Government knows the real situation in society, because it has just collected opinions to prepare the LAG. Regarding the governance guidelines for next year, Kou warned that it was necessary to increase the value of some subsidies and make the conditions for receiving support clearer.
