Regarding the financial contribution plan, Kou Ngon Fong revealed that he had received several complaints about the lack of transparency in the implemented rules that require residents to spend 183 days in Macau. The association leader therefore asked the government to be clearer about the criteria applied and to explain them very well publicly.

item.title: Employment | Calls for measures to improve access in construction and retail
item.description: Deputy Leong Pou U argues, in a statement, that measures are necessary to promote employment in the construction sector. Although the latest employment survey by the Statistics and Census Bureau (DSEC) shows a drop in the unemployment rate, Leong Pou U warns of the poor employment situation in some economic sectors, such as construction and retail sales. Leong Pou U emphasizes that unemployment mostly originated in these two sectors, according to DSEC data. In this way, the deputy, linked to the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM), argues that the Government must launch specific support measures, to provide a situation of full employment in the construction sector. Leong Pou U talks about the underemployment situation for many workers in this sector, taking into account that both public and private work have suffered reductions, in addition to the fact that salaries have been frozen for many years. For this reason, the deputy suggests that the Government increases the proportion of workers residing in public works awarded, as well as launching more public works projects.

item.title: New health post in Zone A opened yesterday
item.description: The inauguration ceremony of the new health post in Zone A of the New Urban Landfills took place yesterday, which officially starts operating today. According to a note from the Macau Health Services (SS), this health post has an area of ​​around 1,066 square kilometers and will provide services from Monday to Friday, from 8:30 am to 1:00 pm and from 2:30 pm to 6:00 pm, closing on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. It is a family health unit, which provides “holistic, comprehensive, coordinated and continuous medical services that cover the entire life cycle, including health care for children, women and adults in general, unscheduled outpatient consultations, prevention and treatment of chronic diseases, health promotion, general nursing care, vaccinations and provision of basic medicines”. The SS estimates that the population in Zone A will be 96 thousand people, so, in the first phase of operation, this health post will be equipped with “six health professionals and administrative staff to provide services to the first batch of inhabitants of that area”, and, “in the future, dynamic adjustment [of professionals] will be carried out according to the actual situation”. These explanations were given by Alvis Lo, director of the SS, at the inauguration ceremony of the new health post. Comprehensive Services Alvis Lo also declared that the Health Post of Zone A of Novos Urban Landfills is the first public health institution to be opened in UOPG [Operational Planning and Management Unit] East-2, providing “convenient and comprehensive community medical services to residents of the aforementioned Zone”. The SS director also recalled the existence, throughout the territory, of nine health centers and four posts, including the space opened yesterday. Alvis Lo also highlighted that “today, more than 80 percent of patients with chronic diseases in Macau opt for health centers to receive treatment, which demonstrates that the objective of global health coverage has preliminarily been achieved”.

item.title: CCAC / Elections | Cases of corruption and illegal propaganda in the MP
item.description: The CCAC reveals that the individual investigated for electoral bribery confessed to the act and is thus practically guaranteed at least one month in Coloane. The electoral law does not allow the suspension of prison sentences The Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC) revealed that it had referred a case of electoral corruption and another of illegal propaganda on election day to the Public Ministry (MP). The information was revealed yesterday through a statement, and the cases are related to the September Legislative elections. According to information from the CCAC, one of those targeted had posted several online publications admitting that he was willing to sell his voting rights, as long as he was paid. “During the inspection of electoral propaganda activities, the CCAC discovered that an individual circulated messages and posted comments on social media with the aim of publicly requesting money from third parties, promising to vote in accordance with the indicated voting direction”, stated in the statement. “The individual in question admitted to committing the crime, claiming that he hoped, in this way, to obtain pecuniary advantages”, it was added. In this scenario, the person being investigated is indicted for the crime of electoral corruption, for soliciting a bribe, and is therefore guaranteed a stay of at least one month in Coloane prison, in case of conviction. The crime is punishable only with a prison sentence of up to three years and does not allow payment of a fine. Therefore, as the electoral law does not allow the suspension of prison sentences, however short they may be, in case of conviction the defendant will spend at least a month in Coloane. Promotion platform Regarding the second case, of illegal propaganda, the CCAC states that it happened on September 14th, when an individual “used social communication software to send propaganda messages for a candidate list, with image and text, in several communication groups with more than a hundred members, appealing to participants in these groups to vote for the respective candidate group”. However, the CCAC statement did not reveal which list benefited from the alleged illegal campaign action. Despite this, the subject, unlike the corruption case, will be able to avoid Coloane's arrest. According to electoral law, electoral propaganda on election day is punishable by a prison sentence of up to one year or a fine of 240 days. If found guilty and punished with a fine, the suspect avoids prison. However, if you are sentenced to prison, you will always have to go to the Coloane Prison.

item.title: Budget | Economy grew 8.8 percent in 2024
item.description: The 2024 budget execution report, presented this Tuesday by the Executive in the Legislative Assembly, speaks of real economic growth of 8.8 percent in the space of one year The Macao SAR economy recorded a progressive recovery in 2024, with the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) closing the year with annual growth of 8.8 percent in real terms compared to 2023, it was announced on Tuesday in the Chamber. At current prices, GDP reached 403,310 million patacas, having registered a nominal increase of 9.2 percent, in annual terms, compared to 2023, translating into a recovery in the overall size of Macau's economy to 86.4 percent of the value recorded before the covid-19 pandemic. According to the 2024 Budget execution report, presented to the Legislative Assembly (AL) by Macau's Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip, service exports increased by 9.2 percent, driven by the annual growth of 23.8 percent in the number of visitor arrivals in 2024, in the order of 34.929 million. Exports of gaming services rose by 21.8 percent and exports of other tourist services fell by 6.1 percent due to the relatively high comparison base of the year 2023, but registering an increase of 13 percent compared to 2019. The gross revenues from the various game items in 2024 grew by 23.8 percent, that is, from 183,700 million patacas in 2023 to 227,420 million patacas in 2024, among which the gross revenues from the game of chance worth 226,780 million patacas stood out, which had a weight of 99.7 percent in revenues global gaming gross, representing an increase of 23.9 percent compared to the same period in 2023. Right accounts In 2024, integrated ordinary revenue amounted to 116,060 million patacas, equivalent to 28.8 percent of GDP, representing an increase of 15.5 percent compared to the 100,450 million patacas recorded in 2023. The Macao SAR's integrated ordinary expenditure stood at 97,950 million patacas, or 24.3 percent of GDP, an increase of 8.1 percent compared to the 90,570 million patacas recorded in 2023. The budget execution balance of 18,110 million patacas represented an increase of 83.4 percent compared to the 9,870 million patacas registered in 2023. The report highlights the “continuous improvement in the situation of public finances in 2024”, without any public debt burden, on the contrary, “the value of 4,790 million patacas from the execution balance of the Macao SAR's central budget for 2022 was transferred to the financial reserve. In the year under review, there was also “a positive result in the investment portfolio of 30,950 million patacas, as well as an increase in the financial reserve from 580,470 million patacas at the end of 2023 to 616,210 million patacas at the end of 2024. In the same AL session, the 2024 General Account Audit Report was also presented, with the audit commissioner, Ao Ieong U, giving importance to the emergence of 57 issues relating to management, operations and institutional development in approximately 18 departments. “Feedback on these issues was provided individually to departmental leaders to reinforce oversight of corrective measures,” he noted.

item.title: LAG | Sam Hou Fai goes to AL on November 18th
item.description: The Governing Action Lines (LAG) will be presented by Sam Hou Fai on November 18, Tuesday, at the Legislative Assembly. The calendar on the main pillars of governance for next year was released yesterday, through a statement from the Social Communication Office (CGS). On November 18th, at 3pm, the Chief Executive will go to the Legislative Assembly, to communicate the content of the Lines of Government Action. Two and a half hours later, the traditional press conference takes place at the Government Headquarters. The following day, Wednesday, Sam Hou Fai returns to the chamber to answer deputies' questions about the LAG. Each deputy has the right to ask a question. A question session in the Administration and Justice area is scheduled for November 21st, in what will be a debut in Wong Sio Chak's new portfolio. The session will take place between 9:30 am and 8 pm, with a break between 1 pm and 3 pm. This is the time for all sectoral sessions. On November 24th, it is Tai Kin Ip's turn to come to the chamber, to answer questions on Economy and Finance. On November 26th, Chan Tsz King will make his debut in the hemicycle, to address doubts about the area of ​​security. The last sessions are scheduled for November 28th, with questions on Social Affairs and Culture, and for December 1st, with Raymond Tam answering questions about Transport and Public Works.

item.title: LAG | Academics advocate prudence in spending
item.description: Academics Loi Hoi Ngan and Davis Fong argued, according to the Chinese channel Radio Macau, that in the next Lines of Government Action (LAG), relating to 2026, the Executive must be attentive to maintaining public expenditure within revenue limits and support, in a more precise way, vulnerable groups in society. Loi Hoi Ngan, associate professor at the Faculty of Human and Social Sciences at Macau Polytechnic University, argued that there are external factors causing an impact on Macau, and if fixed financial expenses are too much, this will not bring benefits to the financial health of the territory. Davis Fong, professor at the Faculty of Business Management at the University of Macau, pointed out that the economic recovery is not yet as strong as the increase in the number of visitors, meaning economic uncertainty from abroad could continue until next year. For this reason, Davis Fong calls for a prudent attitude on the part of the Executive, with policies to support businesses in community neighborhoods that have been recovering more slowly.

item.title: Urgency and Operability of Cross-Border Precautionary Measures in Judicial Disputes
item.description: By Lei Wun Kong I. Introduction With the intensification of economic and cultural exchanges in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, conflicts in the areas of cross-border trade, investment and financing, intellectual property and family law have increased significantly. Efficient and predictable cross-border enforcement of court judgments and arbitration awards, together with related safeguard measures, plays an irreplaceable role in protecting the legitimate rights of parties, optimizing the regional business environment and strengthening investor confidence. “Precautionary measures”, as essential judicial guarantee mechanisms, include in mainland China the preservation of assets, the preservation of evidence and the preservation of conduct; in Macau cover urgent and provisional preventive measures to ensure the realization of threatened rights. For example, upon judicial authorization, it is possible to order preventive seizure of the debtor's bank accounts or properties. However, obstacles persist in requesting cross-border precautionary measures. Even if the creditor has filed the main action in Macau/mainland China, if he does not file the main action at the place of preservation within the legal period (e.g. 30 or 10 days after notification of the precautionary decision in accordance with Article 334 of the Code of Civil Procedure), the precautionary measures granted will be extinguished. II. Urgency Statistics from the Guangdong High People's Court reveal that in 2024, the province's courts concluded 2,250 civil and commercial cases involving Macau in the first instance (932 in the Cooperation Zone). On the other hand, a stable growth trend is observed in these cases (2073 in 2023), a pattern that perfectly aligns with the continued economic expansion of the Greater Bay Area and the increase in cross-border investment and trade activities. However, outside of arbitration, the inability to implement effective cross-border precautionary measures allows debtors to exploit legal loopholes to transfer assets located in another jurisdiction (including Macau). Consequently, even in main actions favorable to creditors, there remains a high risk of frustrated execution due to asset loss. III. Efficiency and Operability Cross-border precautionary measures constitute a “preliminary guarantee” for the enforcement of sentences. The absence of mutual recognition mechanisms between the Chinese Mainland and the Macau Special Administrative Region limits judicial effectiveness. Precautionary assistance and cooperation in the execution of sentences are complementary, jointly forming an integral and efficient judicial assistance chain. In the field of civil and commercial judicial assistance, as stipulated in the Agreement on Reciprocal Confirmation and Execution of Judicial Decisions and the Agreement on Mutual Assistance in the Matter of Preliminary Measures in Arbitration Proceedings, between Mainland China and the Macau Special Administrative Region, their decisions are reciprocally recognized and enforceable. Additionally, the aforementioned Agreement regarding Mutual Assistance in matters of Precautionary Measures allows applicants to directly request the court of the other region for the preservation of assets before or after initiating arbitration, effectively preventing the alienation of assets by the debtor. However, in practice, as most disputes lack an arbitration agreement, depending exclusively on legal actions, Macau must deepen negotiations with the mainland with a view to extending this cooperation to litigious precautionary measures (pre- and intra-procedural). Such a mechanism, inspired by the existing arbitration agreement, would eliminate time intervals used to transfer assets before or after starting the process of confirming decisions handed down by courts outside Macau. IV. Conclusions It is urgent to jointly promote the signing of a regional agreement on precautionary measures in legal disputes between Macau and the mainland. For the same reasons, it is imperative to establish similar arrangements with Hong Kong. The aforementioned regional Agreements are not “optional”, but “mandatory”. In addition to solving urgent problems in cross-border judicial practice and constituting the most direct path to regulatory convergence (effectively inhibiting fraudulent transfers of assets between jurisdictions), this is a strategic initiative to build a legalized business environment in the Greater Bay Area aligned with international standards. They will provide a solid institutional safeguard for Macau's integration into national development and strengthen judicial credibility. Note: The above content is based on Lei Wun Kong's speech before the agenda at the Plenary Assembly of the Macau Special Administrative Region in the afternoon of November 4th.

item.title: In search of the golden straw
item.description: In the middle of last month, in Zhuji, Zhejiang, China, Mr. Shou manufactured a straw with 100 grams of gold, intended especially to be used for drinking milk tea. The straw was valued at approximately RMB$100,000. One day, at dusk, Mr. Shou was traveling home on his motorbike. Suddenly, a bump in the road caused the motorcycle to bounce and the straw he was carrying in his pocket fell out. When he couldn't find her, he called the police. The agents, considering the cylindrical shape of the object, realized that it should have rolled off the road and traveled a considerable distance. They ended up finding her next to a sidewalk, about 100 meters from the place where she had fallen. Although it was recovered, the straw was deformed due to the fall. Mr. Shou decided to melt it down and make another one that will be ready next summer. Afterwards, Mr. Shou handed over a banner to the police officers to express his gratitude. This story raises some questions that make us reflect. First, making everyday objects out of gold is undoubtedly a unique manifestation of a personal lifestyle; However, having the carelessness of putting a gold straw in your pocket and needing to ask the police for help to look for it raises the following question: is it reasonable to ask the police to use their resources to make up for personal negligence? What responsibility should the negligent person bear? Now that the straw has been recovered, let's hope the owner takes more care with his belongings in the future. If these types of cases are avoided, problems can be reduced, there will be no need to spend public resources and everyone benefits. Second, the police did not stop working to solve the case even though the person was negligent. On the contrary, he demonstrated professionalism and capacity for resolution. The agents analyzed the characteristics of the object, estimated its location and managed to find the straw in the dark; The two agents involved deserve to be praised. Third, isn't having gold objects for daily use a way of “showing off wealth”, or simply a demonstration that “because you are rich you are willful”? Gold is very valuable and using it to manufacture everyday objects is a unique pleasure. This practical investment is more “realistic” than simply storing it in a box. However, it is not known whether the value of gold will drop if the object is damaged. Gold is valued by weight; Small scratches have little impact on weight, but visible damage can diminish the “artistic” value. The only solution is to remake the straw. Fourth, offering a banner to police officers as a way of showing gratitude is a gesture of respect. However, these agents are public servants and should not accept gifts. Although offering the banner is a symbolic act, the feeling that accompanies it is profound. It represents Mr. Shou's gratitude, praise and respect for the police. It is believed that the gift of the banner was the best gift Mr. Shou could have given and the best gift the police could have received. In short, using a “golden straw” to drink tea with milk is an act that combines preference with wealth. Milk tea does not become sweeter if sipped through a straw, but it increases personal satisfaction. Negligence must be prevented to avoid situations of abuse of public resources. The professionalism and resolution capacity of the police deserve praise. The track may be a small gift, but it carries a deep feeling. In today's society that values ​​money above all else, how many people will understand its true meaning? This news is not particularly relevant to many of our readers, but it can bring a smile to our troubled lives. Whether you are reading us from Portugal, Macau, or anywhere else, I hope this article brings you a moment of relaxation. See you next week. Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor of the Faculty of Management Sciences of the Macau Polytechnic University Email: cbchan@mpu.edu.mo

item.title: Letter from Rita Santos about the archiving of the investigation process by the Portuguese Public Ministry
item.description: Hon. Mr. Dr. Carlos Morais José M. I. Director of Jornal Hoje Macau This request for publication serves to confirm that on October 24th, the Public Prosecutor's Office of Portugal issued an order archiving the criminal proceedings brought against me following formal complaints presented by members of the Socialist Party, mostly residing in Macau. Throughout the process, I have always actively collaborated with the Portuguese authorities in discovering the material truth and, with that, in protecting my good name, honesty and immaculate character, supported by the trust that the Macanese community places in me, which I will never defraud. It was, from what I was offered to know, a case that was never a case, based only on speculation, defamation and attack on character, a typical case of instrumentalization of justice with political-partisan objectives, but which were not achieved. And, therefore, as expected, with the Public Prosecutor's Office carrying out a thorough investigation, finding that no illegality had been committed and concluded by the absence of criminal evidence, archiving is the logical corollary and would always be the only and fair solution to this “non-prosecution”. Values ​​such as respect for the Law and the individual freedom of each citizen are non-negotiable for me and I will never give up on them, which is why I will never stop, as I have always done, being an active voice in defending democratic and humanist principles, and having an active civic participation in defending the interests of the Portuguese community in Macau. With best regards. Macau, on October 31, 2025. Rita Santos

item.title: The drug kills you if you get enough
item.description: Gone are the days when opium inspired Camilo Pessanha. In which a goose calmed down and slept well. Today, drugs kill. It kills hundreds of young people who become addicted to heroin, cocaine and psychoactive chemical substances that destroy the brain. Those addicted to the most diverse drugs inject themselves into their veins and when there is no purity in the product, they overdose and die. There were young people in Portugal who, affected by a hangover, beat their parents for not giving them the money they wanted and then committed suicide. Overdose deaths increased by 16 percent in 2023 compared to the previous year, totaling 80, revealed a report from the Institute for Addictive Behaviors and Addictions (ICAD) released last year, with cocaine being the drug most responsible for mortality. A few days ago, a 14-year-old minor killed his mother with his father's pistol and the Judiciary Police have already added to the file data indicating that the young man was consuming excessive cannabis. And what are drug addicts? Simply dependent on the multi-million dollar organized crime business where the drug lords earn millions of euros. Last week, we saw two cases in Portugal of shouting to the heavens. A GNR mega-operation that discovered several farms on the outskirts of the Tagus River where 13 speedboats, 11 galleys, a truck, 30 sophisticated engines, 16 top-of-the-range cars, 750 thousand euros in cash and many firearms and bladed weapons were manufactured and stored. 32 suspects were arrested in connection with international drug trafficking, an operation that included the cooperation of the Spanish Guardia Civil. Thus, a criminal network operating in Portugal was dismantled and dedicated to the construction and movement of speedboats to transport drugs from large ships from Colombia and Brazil. This operation had been ongoing for 32 months. During the investigation, several suspects of Spanish nationality were identified. The three-year investigation also led to the arrest in Spain of dozens of drug traffickers and tons of narcotics. Also last week, the country was shocked by the death of a GNR soldier and three others who were injured after a collision between a GNR vessel and another allegedly belonging to drug traffickers on the Guadiana River, near Alcoutim, Faro. According to an observer of the accident, the traffickers purposely threw their boat at the GNR boat, ramming it and killing one of the soldiers on board, and then setting fire to their boat on one of the banks of the river so that there would be no evidence of drug possession. The same observer said that it was “an authentic homicidal act”. The President of the Republic described the situation as “painful” and “regrettable”. Meanwhile, the Judiciary Police and the GNR have already arrested two suspects of having been involved in the collision of the GNR vessel that caused the soldier's death. Apparently, the two suspects were already known for drug trafficking in Spain. The suspects were arrested when they tried to cross a bridge, in a Spanish-registered car, on their way to the neighboring country. They would have large amounts of money in their possession. When we contacted a GNR spokesperson, he stated that "Normally, when it comes to cocaine, the origin is South America and traffickers transfer it in the Atlantic. If it is hashish trafficking, the origin is North Africa, passing the narcotic product from a larger vessel, in the Mediterranean, to these speedboats that then try to enter Europe, using Portugal and Spain." Before fleeing, the suspects ended up stranded on the riverbank, then setting fire to the boat, which was possibly full of drugs. The same spokesperson added that “normally in these cases, the vessels come from the high seas, land (the drugs) in both the Guadiana and the Pedras River, in Spain, burn the boat and then escape.” All this criminal activity is facilitated because the military does not have the necessary means to fight efficiently. The Government simply laments when a tragedy happens and the President of the Republic and the Minister of Internal Administration rush to the funeral of the soldier killed by drug traffickers, giving an air of great regret. A scene that the family members ignored because the important thing is the disregard that the authorities have given to the calls from security force associations for increased funding to combat drug trafficking. And our position is so significant that it was only hours after the fatal event in Alcoutim that President Marcelo promulgated a diploma regulating the use of speedboats. Possibly if the diploma had been promulgated months ago, the GNR soldier would not have died. As people say, after the robbery, you lock the door...

item.title: Success of “book exchange” leads IC to organize more sessions
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) decided to extend the deadline for carrying out the “Book Exchange” initiative, which covers various activities in the territory's public libraries and community neighborhoods, in order to encourage reading. According to a statement, the extension of the program is due to the fact that “the activity has been widely acclaimed”, so there will be more sessions on weekends during this month and also in December, in order to “further expand the circulation and sharing of books”. Therefore, this weekend, Saturday and Sunday, new book exchange sessions will take place at Praça de Luís de Camões, and then at Largo do Lilau on the 27th and 28th of December. These two sessions join those previously scheduled for the Lateral Space of Jardim Cidade das Flores, on the 22nd and 23rd of November. The timing of all sessions is from 12pm to 6pm. For these sessions, IC describes, “participants only need to take the books that comply with the exchange rules to the staff on site, selecting their favorites and exchanging them for a number equal to their own books”. Standards to comply with The rules determine that magazines, leaflets, guides for entering a school, school books, event catalogs, children's books, yearbooks published non-locally, legal books, exam preparation books, books with pornographic and/or violent content, religious books, books without a publishing license or with copyright infringements, books with incomplete or damaged pages, volumes of books belonging to an incomplete collection, books with loose binding, with pages that are easy to separate or with missing pages cannot be exchanged. pages, books with written or scribbled pages and books with more than five copies. In order to maintain the timeliness and usefulness of the books, science and engineering books published more than five years ago, computer books published more than three years ago, tourist guides published more than two years ago are not accepted. Each person can exchange a maximum of 20 books during the event.

item.title: CCM | Opera performance season runs until March
item.description: It is on the 27th of this month that the first cultural initiative integrated into the “1st Season of Chinese Culture Shows” begins. These are “A Gathering of Heroes, Invoking the East Wind and The Huarong Passage”, Chinese opera pieces written by the Chinese National Peking Opera Company. But there are more shows to see until March next year This week, Tuesday, the program for the “1st Season of Chinese Culture Shows” was presented, an “artistic banquet” promising “excellent shows with diverse experiences”. The initiative was created from the previous “Season of Performances of National Art Companies in Macau”, with the first performance taking place on November 27th, with the Beijing opera “A Meeting of Heroes. Invoking the East Wind. The Passage of Huarong”, presented in a three and a half hour show by the Chinese National Peking Opera Company, at the Macau Cultural Center (CCM). According to the official description of the show, main artists Yu Kuizhi and Li Shengsu take to the stage, leading the cast that presents “the Chinese lyrical tradition in all its expressiveness”. “Three great plays” and “epics taken from the classic Romance of the Three Kingdoms” are presented, with a “mix of singing and theatrical staging, which highlights a perfect balance between civil and military characters, embodied by a series of historical figures”. On the 28th of this month, it is time to perform, also at CCM, “The Legend of the White Snake”, written by the famous playwright Tian Han and originally directed by the prestigious director Li Zigui. "This recognized masterpiece has been meticulously refined on stage for more than 60 years. Considered a fundamental work of the operatic repertoire, the piece has been performed by countless generations of 'dan' (female roles) performers", reads the show's description. On stage, the artists are Li Shengsu, a distinguished representative and defender of the Mei Lanfang school, who is also a mentor to the talented Zhu Fengyi, an artist with whom she shares the main role of Bai Suzhen (Madam White Snake). “In this re-enactment, the performers magnificently portray the unshakable forbidden love that the legendary character has for a mortal, transporting the audience to a mesmerizing dreamlike scenario”, it also reads. New interpretations The program for this initiative also includes theatrical performances such as “Goodbye, My Concubine”, performed by the Beijing People's Theatre. It is an adaptation based on the original creation of Nobel Prize winner for Literature Mo Yan, and which has as its backdrop the historical confrontation Chu–Han. “The play breaks with the traditional narrative structure of historical drama and explores eternal themes such as power, survival and responsibility through multiple encounters and dialogues that cross time and space between consort Yu and Empress Lü”, it can be read. The performance of the dance theater piece “Mulan”, by the Ningbo Arts and Entertainment Group, is also scheduled. This “main line is filial piety, loyalty, courage and love, combining dance, martial arts, drama and technological elements”. Groups such as the Chinese Coal Mine Artistic Troupe and the Chinese National Opera will also be invited to carry out exchange performances in various locations in Macau, namely in schools and community neighborhoods. Also noteworthy is the fact that the National Opera of China will return to performances in Macau in January next year to present “Golden Lotus Flowers – Concert of Vocal Works of the National Opera of China” in several schools. “The concert brings together masterpieces of Chinese and foreign vocal music, with rich musical pieces and exceptional artists, taking students on a musical journey that crosses East and West”, it is said. In total, this first season includes eight exchange presentations and 50 community activities. “Using Chinese culture as a connecting link, the event aims to create a cultural event that involves the entire population, promote emotional resonance and cultural transmission, working together to build a happy, beautiful and harmonious circle of life,” it is described.

item.title: “Message” by Fernando Pessoa translated into Timorese Tetum
item.description: The first translation of Fernando Pessoa's “Message” into Tetum, the official language of East Timor alongside Portuguese, is presented tomorrow, in an effort to bring “the greatest work” of the writer “to readers all over the world”. "We wanted to be the first to launch some editions. Last year we launched it in Hindi, which is the fifth most spoken language in the world, and which had no translation", highlighted the communications director of Valor do Tempo, the group that acquired the Lisbon café and which moved forward with translations of Fernando Pessoa's work in 2020. According to Sónia Santiago, the group wanted to “have the ‘Message’ again in more editions”, so they chose Tetum, after discovering, in a conversation with Fernando Pessoa specialist Ricardo Belo de Moraes, that there was no work translated into this official language of Timor-Leste. The edition also has an introduction about Fernando Pessoa's relationship with A Brasileira do Chiado. With the temporary closure of the café due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the group had more “time to think” about how they could “present A Brasileira to the world”, having decided to “start translating the ‘Message'”, as they “receive customers from so many places”, who purposely go “to take photographs with the statue [of Fernando Pessoa] that is on the terrace”, he added. In 2021, the group launched an edition of the work in Portuguese and bilingual editions in English, French, Spanish, Mandarin, and later, in German and Italian. The group began preparing translations of the book into other languages ​​in 2024, focusing on new editions, particularly in Hindi, launched in October of that year. Birthday season The launch of the work in Tetum “acquires particular significance as it takes place in the month in which A Brasileira do Chiado celebrates 120 years of existence, on the 19th of November, and in which Timor-Leste marks, on the 28th of the same month, the 50th anniversary of the first declaration of independence”, according to a statement. The translation of the work “Mensagem”, an edition of A Brasileira do Chiado, was written by Paulo Henriques, trainer, translator and guest professor of the Master's Degree in Teaching Portuguese in the Context of Timor-Leste at the National University of Timor-Leste. The group will announce on Friday the launch of editions of the Message in Romanian, Arabic, Polish, Russian, and Ukrainian, which is also a new translation. The launch of the work will take place on Friday, at 11am, at Instituto Camões, in Lisbon, in a session open to the public. The event is attended by the ambassador of Timor-Leste in Lisbon, Isabel Amaral Guterres, the president of Instituto Camões, Florbela Paraíba, the president of Fundação Oriente, Carlos Monjardino, with the translator, Paulo Henriques, participating via video call from the Timorese capital, Díli.

item.title: Grand Prix | The years from 1967 to 1978 by Victor H. de Lemos
item.description: The Grand Prix is ​​Macau's motor sport par excellence, and there are residents who have always dedicated themselves to this passion. Victor H. de Lemos was one of them, and the second part of his estate will be released today in a book at the headquarters of APOMAC – Association of Retirees, Retirees and Pensioners of Macau. HM spoke with his son about the launch of the second volume of Macau Grand Prix – Personal Collection of Victor H. de Lemos (1967-1978) “My father was very proud of his work.” This is how Carlos Lemos, son of Victor H. Lemos, the great collector of images and materials related to the Macau Grand Prix (GPM) competition, tells HM the parade of memories that are now also paraded on the pages of a book. This is the second volume of the “Macau Grand Prize – Personal Collection of Victor H. de Lemos”, this time dedicated to the years 1967 to 1978. In 2023, the first volume was released, focusing on the years 1954 to 1966. The two editorial projects are supported by the Association of Retirees, Retirees and Pensioners of Macau (APOMAC). The launch event for the second volume takes place today from 3pm, at APOMAC headquarters. This work contains, as described by Carlos Lemos, “newspapers, photos and GPM events from 1967 to 1978”, and there is no shortage of records of notable episodes of the competition on the Guia Circuit. Included are “articles related to the first fatal accident on the circuit of popular Filipino racer Arsenio Dodgie Laurel, who was a two-time GPM winner, or articles about the failed creation of the Far East Motor Racing Association (FEMRAC) Circuit”. There are also, in these pages, records “of the first Guia Race and motorcycle races, and of the first female driver to win the ‘Current Production Cars’ race”. The reader will also be able to find “the race of giants, with the participation of famous racers in the world such as Dan Gurney, Jacky Ickx, who was six times winner of the 24 hours Le Mans, Sir Stirling Moss; Jack Brabham, the only driver to win the Formula 1 championship in a car that bears his name (Brabham); Roy Salvadori”. “In the last section of the book I made a small introduction with around 100 photos from another collection of my father, entitled ‘World of Motorsport’, which contains almost two thousand photos autographed by drivers, car owners, designers and renowned personalities in the world related to motorsport such as ‘Il Commendatore’ Enzo Ferrari, Juan Manuel Fangio or Sir Jackie Stewart.” Life of dedication Victor H. Lemos created this collection on a more permanent basis while he lived in Macau, and from 1975 onwards the Macanese, emigrating to Canada, began to have difficulties in having his collection updated. "He depended on friends to send photos, newspapers and programs for his collection, and decided to finish the project in 1978, on the 50th anniversary [of the competition]. Volume 2 completes a significant part of the collection", he told HM. Carlos Lemos admits that he had to leave material out of this edition and that the selection process “was difficult”. “I decided to include the most important parts that are of greatest interest to GPM fans, otherwise it would be a bulkier book,” he said. In the years visually described in this work, there was “the transition from ‘Sport’ and ‘GT’ type cars to ‘Formula’ type cars with more powerful and faster engines”. "The participation of racers from other parts of the world such as Australia, England, Germany and with cars partitioned by factories such as BMW and Renault-Alpina also began, ceasing to be an amateur event. It was also a period of improvement and modernization of the circuit", described Carlos Lemos. Victor H. Lemos “dedicated a lot to this collection”. “After work, he would wait in the corridors and hotel lobbies to collect the signatures” of the pilots. “People made fun of him, but this collection is, today, probably the most complete in the GPM and contains information that is highly sought after.” Regarding the possibility of this personal estate being part of the GPM Museum collection, Carlos Lemos assures that there is nothing new. “We touched on this subject twice, a few years ago, and this suggestion was also made when the first volume was released, but nothing came to fruition.”

item.title: Rua dos Mercadores | Traffic prohibited until Monday
item.description: The traffic ban on Rua dos Mercadores, created due to work being carried out at the site, and which should come to an end today, will have to be extended until Monday. At issue is the “need to cure the paving concrete”, with the closure of Rua dos Mercadores to traffic and the reverse measures on Rua das Estalagens and Rua de Camilo Pessanha remaining until 10pm on Monday. Regarding the bus service, bus route no. 18 (direction to Rua dos Currais) will temporarily continue without making stops at “Avenida de Almeida Ribeiro/Tai Fung”, “Rua dos Mercadores”, “Rua das Estalagens” and “Rua de Cinco de Outubro”. During this period, the “Ponte 16” or “Rua do Tarrafeiro” stops can be used for entrances and exits. The work is expected to end on November 27th, as defined since the beginning of the project, related to the underground cable network, “greater than initially planned and required better reorganization”. The third, and final, phase of the works takes place between Tuesday and the 27th of this month, “with the intervention area concentrated predominantly on internal roads in the area, not affecting the original direction of traffic”, describes the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT).

item.title: Colégio S. José 5th | Teacher accused of humiliating student
item.description: In response to the complaint, the school admits an internal investigation into the case, but warned the complainant to prepare for the consequences, because “the Internet is not a lawless space”. The Government reportedly received a complaint about the case on October 14th, but until now it has remained silent A teacher at Colégio Diocesano de São José 5ª is being accused of humiliating a student with autism, allegedly using insulting words, after leaving the student waiting more than 80 minutes for a meeting. The complaint was published on social media, on Monday, by an anonymous user, who justifies the use of this medium with the fact that complaints to the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services (DSEDJ) and the school were ignored. According to the report presented online, the episode took place on October 10th in the school's teachers' room. The student with autism, who attends secondary school, had an appointment with the teacher. However, the teacher arrived 80 minutes late and reprimanded the student: "But you can never do anything well, except be here waiting? Why didn't you ask another teacher to call me?", the teacher asked. "I taught you so many times, but you never listen! You always act as if I never taught you anything", he added. The words disturbed the student who raised his voice against the teacher. However, she again admonished the student: "You are not authorized to speak in that tone of voice! Never speak to a teacher in that way", warned the teacher. After the reprimand, the teacher will have justified, in front of the other teachers present, the arguments used with the fact that the student suffers from autism. List of complaints In view of the case, the author of the online comment admits to having filed a complaint about the teacher's conduct with the DSEDJ, the school's management, the Institute of Social Action, and several deputies, including José Pereira Coutinho, for having received the most votes in the last elections, and Ho Ion Sang, elected indirectly by the education sector. In the complaints presented, an independent investigation into the case was requested, that the teacher be punished due to her conduct and that a review be carried out of the mechanisms for students to defend themselves against teachers when they are targets of abuse. Although the complaint was made on October 14th, by November 3rd the complainant had not received any response, so he decided to make the complaint public, through social media. School investigates With the case going viral, Colégio Diocesano de São José 5ª issued a statement on Tuesday promising an internal investigation, but warning that it will act against defamation attempts. "Recently, our institution became aware of anonymous online complaints about members of our faculty. These allegations concern issues of professional conduct [...] The school takes these matters very seriously and immediately initiated a rigorous internal investigation," the institution said. Furthermore, the college revealed that DSEDJ has started to investigate the case: “The school always defends the rights and legitimate interests of staff and students and will actively cooperate with the supervision and investigation work that has already been initiated by the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services”, it was revealed. Despite this, the school was prepared to target the complainant: “In accordance with the principle of management based on ‘the truth of the facts’, the school […] reserves the right to demand legal responsibility against any fabrications of facts, malicious threats or damage to the reputation of the school and employees — ‘the internet is not a lawless space’!”, it was highlighted. DSEDJ and Coutinho in silence In light of the accusations and inaction, HM contacted DSEDJ to confirm the existence of a complaint dated 14 October and to obtain a reaction to the fact that the complaint remained without any response until the beginning of November. However, at the closing time of the HM edition, no response had been received. As the online publication specifically targeted deputy José Pereira Coutinho, HM tried to get a reaction from the legislator. “I don’t know where this invention came from,” replied the deputy. “I don’t make any comments”, he pointed out. “I am very busy serving dozens of citizens every day in our Citizens Assistance Office”, he added.

item.title: Galaxy | Revenues grow 14% in the third quarter
item.description: In the one-year period, Galaxy's net revenues grew 14 percent. Francis Lui, president of the group, pointed out that the third quarter numbers were achieved, despite the casinos being closed for 33 hours The Galaxy dealership announced an annual increase in net revenues of 14 percent in the third quarter of this year. The data was released yesterday by the concessionaire through a statement. Between July and September, the company that manages the casino with the same name recorded net revenues of 12.2 billion Hong Kong dollars, which represented growth compared to the value of 10.7 billion Hong Kong dollars allocated in the third quarter of 2024. When the comparison is made between the second and third quarters of this year, the growth was less significant, just 1 percent, given that between April and June total net revenue was 12.0 billion Hong Kong dollars. Still in relation to the third quarter, the bulk of the company's revenue founded by Lui Che Woo was due to gaming, which contributed to net revenue with 9.7 billion Hong Kong dollars, while the non-gaming sector brought the company revenues of 1.7 billion dollars. At the same time, Galaxy's building materials segment generated revenues of $727 million, the only segment showing a negative trend. Over the three months between July and September, adjusted EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization) reached 3.3 billion Hong Kong dollars. This amount meant an annual increase of 14 percent, but a reduction of 6 percent, compared to the second quarter of this year. Limited numbers Reacting to the numbers, in a statement, the president of Galaxy, Francis Lui, stated that revenues were affected by the fact that September is a month traditionally with low revenues and due to the passage of typhoon Ragasa. "The first factor involved seasonality, given that September is normally a calmer month, with many visitors postponing their trips until October, to coincide with Golden Week. The second event was Typhoon Ragasa", he indicated. "The typhoon led the Government to decree the official closure of all casinos for 33 hours. And 33 hours may not seem like a very long period of time, but it causes potential visitors to cancel their planned visits", he added. At the same time, Lui also addressed the closure of the Waldo casino, which took place on October 31st: "In accordance with Government policies, the Galaxy Group is committed to safeguarding local employment. In addition to being able to maintain the same positions, employees also had the opportunity to explore a variety of career paths, if they so desired, and received support to transition to a new work environment", he highlighted.

item.title: GP Macau | Government promises to fight the black market
item.description: The Grand Prix Organizing Committee admitted having created a task team against the sale of tickets on the black market. The revelation was made by Lei Si Leng, president of the Sports Institute and coordinator of the Grand Prix Organizing Committee. According to the official's statements, new measures were also adopted in the production of tickets, to prevent counterfeiting, and wristbands will be distributed to prevent tickets from being resold after they have been used. “Reselling even just a penny above the purchase price is illegal,” he said. Lei Si Leng also clarified that people who buy tickets and are unable to attend the races can sell them, as long as they do so at or below the purchase price. The statements were made on the sidelines of the Pai San Grand Prix ceremony and Lei Si Leng revealed that at this time around 90 percent of tickets have been sold and that tickets for Saturday and Sunday are sold out. In addition, some tickets will be reserved to be sold on the day of the races. The person in charge also explained that at this stage the circuit is practically assembled and the organization is now ready to start receiving the cars and motorcycles that will participate in the event.

item.title: Commerce | Association expects greater exchange between companies
item.description: The president of the Macau Commercial Association, Ma Chi Ngai, wants to promote greater cooperation between different companies, as a result of the World Convention of Chinese Entrepreneurs. This event was organized by the Macau Commercial Association and took place between the 2nd and 4th of November. Speaking to the Ou Mun newspaper, the businessman stated that the event should lead to greater long-term commercial exchange between participating companies. Ma considered that it results from the increasingly close cooperation between the association and the Institute for Trade and Investment Promotion (IPIM) and that the two entities actively participated in identifying potential participants. Ma Chi Ngai pointed out that there was the participation of around 600 Chinese businesspeople from all over the world, and that more than 300 individual meetings were held, which in his opinion exceeded the organization's expectations. During the event, around ten contracts or cooperation intentions were signed, covering companies from countries participating in the One Belt and One Road initiative and Southeast Asia.

item.title: Flu | Alert for active virus and more people in the emergency room
item.description: The Health Services issued a note stating that “in recent days” more people have been using the emergency units at Kiang Wu and Conde de São Januário hospitals, taking into account that, in the last 15 days, the positivity rate for the influenza virus has been increasing. In turn, the success of the flu vaccine stands out, with annual increases in doses The influenza virus, responsible for the flu, has been more active in the territory. The authorities, more specifically the Macau Health Services (SS), reported this in a note issued yesterday. “In the last two weeks in Macau (between 12 and 25 October), the positivity rate for detecting the influenza virus was 28.9 and 26.5 percent, respectively, exceeding 13.1 percent”, this being the alert level in the region. These data show that, “in general, the influenza virus is active”, in addition to that “in recent days, the number of people who used the Emergency Service at Centro Hospitalar Conde de São Januário and Kiang Wu Hospital on a daily basis has been increasing”. Taking these data into account, the SS warn of the importance of vaccinating the most vulnerable groups against influenza, highlighting the success of the program. “As of November 3, around 94 thousand people were vaccinated against seasonal flu, representing an increase of around 8 percent compared to the same period last year, in which 87 thousand people were vaccinated.” In this way, the SS consider “the progress of vaccination of high-risk groups to be satisfactory”. New cases Since October, the SS “has been sending, on its own initiative, health professionals to homes, daycare centers and preschools, among other relevant establishments in Macau, in order to carry out collective vaccination, providing residents with different forms and convenient vaccination services”. However, this Tuesday four cases of flu were detected in schools. One of them occurred in a third-year secondary class at the Choi Nong Chi Tai School, located on the Ferreira do Amaral Isthmus, with nine students infected. Another case was detected in a class at the School of Application Attached to the University of Macau, with five students infected. The remaining two cases occurred at Escola Secundária Pui Va and Escola Internacional de Macau, infecting fifteen students in total. Symptoms began to appear on October 30th, with the patients' clinical status being considered “mild”, with no “cases or other serious complications” occurring. Of the four collective cases, 26 students tested positive for Flu A.

item.title: TSI | Kong Chi accused of 79 crimes in new trial
item.description: Kong Chi's second trial began with lawyer Ho Kam Meng's defender, one of the defendants in the case, raising doubts about the legality of Deputy Prosecutor Kuok Un Man's participation in this case. Yesterday, at the Court of Second Instance (TSI), the second trial of former Deputy Prosecutor Kong Chi, who faces charges of committing 79 crimes, began. Among these crimes, the Public Prosecutor's Office (MP) believes that 67 were committed in co-authorship with lawyer Ho Kam Meng. The first hours of yesterday's session were used by judge Choi Mou Pan to read the pronouncement order, a procedure that lasted more than three hours. However, even before the reading, Lau Io Keong, Ho Kam Meng's lawyer, raised doubts about the legality of Deputy Public Prosecutor Kuok Un Man's participation in the trial. The lawyer argued that Kuok should be prevented from doing so, due to the fact that she was the representative of the MP in the pre-trial phase of the case. The lawyer drew a parallel with the situation of the investigating judge, who after participating in this phase of the process is prevented from conducting the trial. In his response, Choi Mou Pan considered that the impediment should only be invoked in the case of a conflict of interest or when there are family connections, which he indicated was not the case in this case. The judge also considered that the MP has the power to choose the representatives he sees fit. Even so, Choi told Lau Io Keong that if he wished he could present the matter in writing, which would then be analyzed by the panel of five judges. In relation to the indictment order, Kong Chi is accused of having committed a total of 23 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act: 10 co-authored with Ho Kam Meng, two co-authored with Ho Kam Meng and businesswoman Choi Sai Ieng, three co-authored with businesswoman Choi Sai Ieng and lawyer Kuan Hoi Lon and eight co-authored with Choi Sai Ieng. Each of these crimes is punishable by a prison sentence of up to eight years in prison. The indictment also adds to the 23 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act allegedly committed by Kong Chi, another 56 crimes of malfeasance, all co-authored with Ho Kam Meng. These crimes are punishable by up to five years in prison. Criminal association Ho Kam Meng is the second defendant in the case and the only one accused of creating/being part of a secret association, whose punishment can be up to 12 years. This association involves Kong Chi and Choi Sai Ieng, who were convicted of this crime in the first trial. The lawyer is also accused of another 68 crimes, including 12 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act (10 co-authored with Kong Chi and 2 co-authored with Kong Chi and Choi Sai Ieng) and 56 crimes of malfeasance co-authored with Kong Chi. Businesswoman Choi Sai Ieng is accused of 13 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act, eight co-authored with Kong Chi, two co-authored with Kong Chi and Ho Kam Meng, three co-authored with Kong Chi and Kuan Hoi Lon. Finally, Kuan Hoi Lon, the only one of the defendants who was not in court, being partly uncertain, is accused of three crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act, co-authored with Kong Chi Meng and Choi Sai Ieng. Customers, lunches and payments Reading the indictment order revealed that the defendants are accused of having used Kong Chi's functions to “sell” acquittals and other favorable decisions during the Public Prosecutor's Office investigations. According to the MP, in most of the crimes, Ho Kam Meng received payments from clients, with the highest value being MOP500,000, and then paid a commission to Kong Chi, often around 10 percent of the amount received. In return, the investigated defendants were able to obtain favorable decisions, orchestrated by Kong Chi, ranging from acquittal, by archiving the cases, to the lifting of coercive measures or access to seized assets. This type of modus operandi was also used by Choi Sai Ieng and Kuan Hoi Lon. The cases in which Kong Chi intervened had very different natures, involving investigations into fraud, illegal work, drug use, theft or usury for gambling. Payments from Ho to Kong were normally made during lunches, dinners or trips to the interior. Repeated stories Kong Chi is being tried for the second time for allowing himself to be corrupted, as part of his duties as former Deputy Public Prosecutor. In the first case, which came to an end in February this year, Kong was sentenced to 21 years in prison resulting from 1 crime of management or leadership of an association or secret society, 10 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act, 2 crimes of violating court secrecy, 3 crimes of malfeasance, 1 crime of abuse of power, and 2 crimes of inaccuracy of elements. In the first case, Choi Sao Ieng was sentenced to 16 years in prison resulting from conviction for 1 crime of participation in an association or secret society, 9 crimes of passive corruption for an illicit act, 2 crimes of violating court secrecy, 3 crimes of malfeasance, 1 crime of abuse of power. The first trial also ended with the acquittal of lawyer Kuan Hoi Lon, while lawyer Ho Kam Meng is tried for the first time.

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, a villager, represents half the world that recriminates the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters our house, covers his wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on the rapes in Ukraine, in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say to him: hi there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: you still haven't said what name you want to give the children! A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 At a lunch with several guests, I heard a friend, who declared herself a spiritualist, explaining the particularities of her belief, in a calm and balanced way, I would even say, without a hint of “irrationalism”. He spoke at length and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytism. “Here is someone whose belief has brought thoughtfulness!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at a certain moment a sentence comes out that horrifies me. It says, “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, and I glimpse the voracious maws of holism. Because holism has a pathological aspect, like all good things, a shadow side. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa, it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism introduced Compassion and Christianity introduced Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a Platonic stage, where we are nothing more than the shadows of something — an inextricable law -, in a determinism that calcifies all singularities, but that strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity was anchored in the conquest of chance and randomness, removing the incidences of a life from this fierce determinism that enclosed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at that moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and its volition were able to emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “there is no such thing as chance, nothing happens by chance!”, which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is usually used to seek a reason for things outside of us, in others. It's an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough to want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this mistake. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic awareness has brought a positive impact to greater ecological awareness, but followed with scholastic rigor, it stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than uncomfortable: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that each moment asks of us — but how many will make the distinction, under a Law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will abandon themselves to what is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic awareness, as the Greeks knew, but it also brings agency and the courage of decision. And we cannot give up on this. Furthermore, as Drummond shows in the poem “Quadrilha”, by Carlos Drummond de Andrade: «João loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who didn't love anyone./ João went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of a disaster, Maria stayed with her aunt,/ Joaquim committed suicide and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story.» Real always runs outside the track, completely outside our concepts. That's what matters to us — a J. Pinto Fernandes emerges at the exact moment when we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: From Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 When reading many people's reactions when this year's Nobel Prize for Literature was announced, I couldn't help but remember this comment from Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: «An editor of a large national daily newspaper wrote five lines of indignation at the fact that the Nobel Prize for Literature had been awarded to Thomas Traströmer, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did it not occur to this literary columnist, patented and paid to do his job, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of professional misconduct? Tranströmer had been translated into many languages, it was available in French.» There is always the chorus of those who wait for the Prize to be announced to complain about not having been invited to be on the jury, there is a subgroup of angry people who profess “I have never read it and I won’t even bother to read it”; It is a less than humble fauna, the one that inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners – I didn't know about the existence of Louise Glück, who I think is a great poet, or Olga Tokarczuk, for example – but this only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows everyone else and the joy of recognizing that the yardstick of the world is not measured with my short measure and that, on the contrary, it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown and learn from it. And perhaps the most stupid reaction was that of the intelligent man who wrote, But are there still people who read French?; simply confirming that today there is a new type of ignorance that is being raised with abandon: that of those who only read English. I would also prefer that, in French, Pascal Quignard, Linda Lê or even Sollers were awarded, or, among the new ones, Mathias Énard, but that does not detract from the dignity of Annie Ernaux's work (and it would have been enough to have written “Les Années”). There are books of hers that I like less, like the vulgar “Uma Paixão Simples”, but that happens with almost all authors, they have pivotal books and others that are like breaks in their itinerary. I recommend reading a beautiful book of interviews with her, “L’écriture comme un couteau”. 11/10/22 Yesterday an article appeared in the morning newspaper “Notícias”, in Maputo, reporting that the Pen Club Narrative Prize had been awarded to my wife, Teresa Noronha, for her soap opera “Tornado”, which had already won the Maria Velho da Costa Prize. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, as it is pathetic, but what is important to highlight is the note of disqualification regarding its “Mozambicanness” when they call it Luso-Mozambican. It's not that it's inaccurate, but, for those who know the context, it's a touch naughty. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, Álvaro Taruma Ronga-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican for writers from the north, etc., etc. Which doesn't appear to happen. At one point, in the novel, she writes: «Our color was never the dominant one. In colonial times we were not white, we were dressed in monhés, mugs of washed asses, the pejorative term to speak of a son of Goan and Portuguese. In the post-colonial period, I was not black and if, in Lisbon, they took me for Brazilian or Cape Verdean, in France they were lost in thought about where I was from and were surprised when they discovered that I was African. There I had to explain the wanderings of my DNA before settling in Mozambique. It took me a long time to accept that it was like that because yes, and that it was no curse that that was the case; on the contrary, I could even discover intense patterns of fantasy and freedom in this harlequin cloak that is our genealogy…” In modern-day Mozambique, it means being white… and that immediately takes precedence over what you do or what you are. It's sad, but as Naipaul warned, in these parts race is everything and people live as deeply immersed in it as, in other places, in religion. 12/10/22 Bruno Latour, an anthropologist who studied the sciences and their procedures and legitimations, law, technique and religions and who entertained himself by turning his back on the dogmas of the “moderns”, has died. For him, the place, the role of the specialist, was defined more by the perplexity he embodied than by the supposed truth that would sustain him. He proposed, as an alternative to the goodness of multiculturalism and its equivocal cliché “all different, all equal”, a return to “diplomacy”, given that this, precisely, does not start from the assumption that “we are unified because we share the same nature” but simply highlights that we “still do not share a common world”; It is necessary that we deal head-on with the “abyss of disagreement” that separates us, instead of trying to deceive it. And about politics he said, boldly: «If transparency is demanded from politicians, we kill them; if anyone demands fidelity to what the other was or what he says, kill him; If a mimetic relationship is required between what the crowd wants and what its representative says, representation is killed. These must therefore, by definition, betray, deceive, modify, distort the word. Without this ability to bend the word and betray, political language would not exist. I put forward the perfectly plausible hypothesis that political vocabulary will become as inaccessible as the religious language of the last twenty, three or fifty years.» (in “Un Monde Pluriel mais Commun”). I believe we will be needed to decipher this frantically complex world that has fallen to us.

item.title: Fuxi
item.description: O my friends, companions of these disastrous journeys through countries as old as the stars and the Moon, and as strange as the deepest interior of our wretched souls, what surprises still await us, what secret magics will we still have to overcome, what horrors will arise before our pupils dilated with astonishment and terror? Increasingly closer to our precarious existences, howls the monster of war, which threatens to merge humanity once and for all with the earth, incessantly traversed by the squalid specter of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pestilences. Oh damned human, who believes you are superior to Nature itself, but then you reveal yourself, time and time again, incapable of simply ordering your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by fickle anger and are a slave to your own ambition! You are not satisfied with white jade or resplendent gold, there is no treasure that quenches your inextinguishable thirst for command over other men, animals and things; for eternal anguish dwells in you; in you the expelled serpents crawl; for you grows, powerful and impressive, the most fertile ivy of Evil! This is perhaps why on the Mount they call the White Deer, where one of the eight immortals on a sacred mount soared through the heavens towards Penglai, lives the fuxi, a bird whose shape resembles that of a rooster, although topped by a human head. What strange copulations, what monstrous embraces, what terrible procedures must have occurred to make the existence of this sinister animal possible? We don't know, but all it takes is for our exhausted mind to dare to come up with an answer, and then we feel our skin covered in horrendous goosebumps and our heart races in parade, like a wild horse whipped by the night whip of fear, unresponsive to reins and containment. Let men refrain from visiting Monte do Veado, because although there are riches capable of calming the wildest ambitions, if they have the unfortunate luck of catching a glimpse of a fuxi, it is certain that a war will soon break out and the cultivated fields will perish, because of it the tame animals will be beheaded, because of it the best young men of two generations will be sacrificed and the pride of the countries will be destroyed. The fuxi makes a sound reminiscent of its name. If you hear it, dark night or clear day, be on your way, because the path you are on is the surest path to misfortune!

item.title: Procrastinators Club
item.description: While rereading Easter, because of an article I'm preparing, I come across this excerpt, taken from “The Universal Man”: «Each man, morally, is one and absolute; but he has to live with attenuating his personality. (…) Coexistence is only possible between people reduced to a negative or hollow presence, which constantly gives way. Hence, the emptiness of society, an immense ghost made up of countless dead people. A superior man is antisocial or criminal. His destiny is prison and the desert”. I hesitate to think whether Pascoaes reflects here on the political-social conditions that muzzle, and, worse, in a sad country like Portugal in the middle of the Estado Novo (and the book is from 1931) where any possibilities of spontaneity and frankness in human relationships were restricted, or if it merely lends to the behavior of (oppressed) men a metaphysical framework, an “essence”, declared in the presumption of each being, in isolation, “one and absolute”. Sometimes, in addition to an excess of Spirituality (or Saudade), Pascoaes lacks the world. He is a great poet, but he is a poet who takes Ampoules-of-Great-Ideas and who therefore writes often trapped by a programmatic furor, ceasing to have pores; It is not uncommon for a glass to be erected between him and reality, the same glass that made him write in O Bailado, from 1921: «Everything is a ghost. There are only clouds, clouds of voices, clouds of souls, of afflictions and tragedies! Clouds and more clouds, appearances and more appearances! And a divine lightning that pierces them, the instantaneous Apparition that appears and throws us to the ground, dazzled!» Sometimes I felt like reminding him, as António Sérgio did, in the article “Regeneration and Tradition, Moral and Economy”, which he dedicated to Pascoaes: «Pascoais, Pascoais my dear friend: you are a pure, excellent and noble poet, but also a victim of this social environment, like us all: of this horrible isolation that you praise and I curse». «As a child, he stole two blackbirds», says Jacinto do Prado Coelho, he stole them from a nest, and he felt remorse for that all his life. The Person, few more mischiefs are known to him. Only in Álvaro de Campos does a hint of wickedness and obscenity emerge: «Ah, and the ordinary and dirty people, who always look the same,/ Who use swear words as usual words,/ Whose sons steal from grocery store doors/ And whose daughters at the age of eight – and I think this is beautiful and I love it! –/ Decent-looking men masturbate in stairwells.” (Triumphal ode). Both poets, driven by a certain idea of ​​sanctity, had the same inability to break the siege of their skin with the overflow of someone else's dam, the same curse of sublimating the concrete ferocity of eros with the gentleness of the verses. Obviously, they are both “bigger than life”, but sometimes it makes me unnerved to watch, from my position as a hatter at the Procrastinators Club, the tantrums between them, just to see who occupies, in the internal organization, the place of President and Treasurer. Although Pessoa guessed more things, for example, what he wrote in the lesser-known Ode Martial and which is reflected in the situation we live in today, in a different way, with his heart in his hands: «MARTIAL ODE (…) Helahoho! helahoho! The poor widow's sewing machine who was bayoneted... She sewed indefinitely in the afternoon… The table where the old people played, Everything mixed, everything mixed with bodies, with blood, All one river, one wave, one dragging horror. Helahoho! helahoho! I unearthed the child's tin train pressed into the middle of the [road, And I cried like all the mothers in the world about the horror of life. My pantheistic feet tripped over the sewing machine [widow who was killed with a bayonet And that poor instrument of peace stuck a spear in my heart. Yes, I was the one to blame for everything, I was the soldier for them all Who killed, raped, burned and broke, It was me and my shame and my remorse like a shadow [misshapen They travel around the world like Ashavero, But behind my steps there are footsteps the size of infinity And a physical fear of being accountable to God makes me close my eyes. [eyes suddenly. (…) I ordered, captain, to shoot the trembling peasants, I let the daughters of all fathers tied to trees be raped, Now I saw that it was inside my heart that all this happened, And everything scalds and suffocates and I can't move without it [everything be the same. God have mercy on me, I didn't have it from anyone! LÀ-BAS, JE NE SAIS OÙ…” What is clear today, at this disastrous moment in which Cristiano & Companhia failed in their mission in Braga, and in which the self-sabotage of Russia's gas pipelines reminds us that Putin will be willing to do anything to maintain dominance over the areas endorsed, is that, bomb for bomb, the “bomb” of the Fifth Empire was preferable. However, even in this, my dears, we were irresolute, a little more on the side of piela than determined, and we procrastinated.
